text: Brunch was fantastic!  Service was great!  The create your own Bloody Mary is fun.  Will go back again and again!

Brunch Review - great atmosphere and friendly service.   Homemade donuts are phenomenal! Had the egg casserole which was flavored well. Only gripes were the over salted potatoes and the lack of flavor in my friends chicken and waffles.   Would definitely return for brunch.
The dessert chocolate chip cookie was unbelievably good! Solid spot for dinner with friends.

This was our first time visit and we had an excellent time during lunch. We came with a large group after our children's graduation to celebrate their accomplishment over the past three years of middle school. The mom of another classmate, made all of the arrangements and she made the right decision for the whole group of parents and family members. We had the whole patio area that mid day afternoon and the weather was perfect. First, the service was great ! The staff waiting on us did a fantastic job. Just at our table, every food item we ordered was delicious. From the meatloaf to the Scottish salmon and our side dishes too. First impressions do make a difference if you are coming back to a restaurant and Bricktop's made a great impression on us, during our luncheon. We will be back again !

The past 3 times we have visited Bricktop's, service has been terrible!! Food is way overpriced as well.  $16 for chicken fingers???? Seriously?!?  I always get the beef  carpaccio as an entree, but my advice is to save your money and get 3x the amount of carpaccio at Brio right down the street.  Last trip we made here was during the final round of the Masters and the servers/bartenders were more interested in watching tv than offering me another round of my $10 martini. Don't waste your time or money at this place.
Great lunch and brunch! Delicious coffee, donuts and chicken and waffles.

I stopped in with my wife for lunch.  This was my first time dining at Bricktop's (just moved to Charlotte from Chicago).  My overall score for Bricktop's is 3.5.  Wedge Salad: 4.  Very good, I liked the chopped raw onion touch.  They even split it for us, no hassle.  BBQ Chicken Flatbread: 3.  Solid flavors.  They use cream cheese on it, which I didn't mind, but a few pieces had a little too much of it.  Veggie Flatbread: 4.  Good Mediterranean flavors, I preferred this to the BBQ Chicken Flatbread.  Ambience/Space:  3.5.  Casual & very comfortable.  They also have a nice outdoor patio under a canopy that would be great on cooler days/nights.    Service: 3. The employees were pleasant when dealing with us, but I sort of got the feeling they didn't want to be there.  Understandable, considering it was Labor Day.  No one enjoys having to work on holidays.  Side note: A waiter walked by with some sushi rolls that looked very good.  Will probably give them a try next time I visit Bricktop's.

This afternoon I took my daughter to lunch with high expectations!  I had heard great things from friends and colleagues - in the "hospitality industry". The appetizer was great but we  had to send the meal back which was corrected - then okay. Our issue - the customer service/waiter was horrific! Did not check on our table as he did with others. But mostly when we advised we were unable to finish our meals - he brought two boxes...we had to ask for bags to carry out and THEN he rushed my daughter asking: "do you want that?" Extremely disappointing I suggest management have him enroll in diversity training class. Hopefully he will learn that "We All" carry the same money and the color is GREEN! Will not return nor refer....

If you are rich, older, and live in South Park- you will love it and fit right in. Was that too much? Seriously, the food is decent and it packs a crowd but I am the only one here that thinks this place is overpriced? I was contemplating the chicken tenders with fries but priced at $18 I wondered if the waiter would cut it up and feed it to me as well. Sadly, he didn't so I settled for the burger which was cheaper. Price isn't an issue for me, I will spend the $$ on a good meal, but Bricktop's just doesn't justify it. For dessert I had the warm chocolate chip cookie a la mode. I love a good dessert! It was pretty large, but a little too chocolatey and why is there NEVER enough ice cream attached to a dessert? The ratio was 4:1 cookie to ice cream. :(  The decor was nice with large booths and the place fills up quickly. If you look around to check out the clientele it is a lot of ladies who lunch with too much botox. I had to ask myself, where am I? If you plan a trip to your dermatologist's office soon and still have some cash to blow, stop by Bricktop's.

No bad food on this menu. My only complaint is that this menu is pricey - especially the wine. 2 glasses of red exceeded my rib entree.  The ribs were the best I've every had & I have had plenty in my lifetime. Think Yelp should have 3 $'s describing it.

I found two pubic hairs in two separate dishes, a lobster bisque and the trout.  The staff was rude to me and my guest for an evening that was in a word: gross in both its uncleanliness and its response - they asked if i wanted another entree ...i said no, ....if i  am the manager I am both embarrassed and and apologetic.  The quality of the food and the management team has slipped from my other visits as well.  It feels more like a chain that special place.
The best place in Charlotte. They are consistent with there service and quality of food. Me and my fiancé dine here weekly. Never had a bad experience.

I went here last weekend with a friend. I ordered the prime rib which was the best prime rib I've eaten in Charlotte. I had their hand cut fries and the yummiest fried onions on the side. The server was friendly and was knowledgeable about the menu and was able to answer specific questions for us. The was a miscommunication on my friend's order and the server pleasantly took it back immediately and corrected the order. This restaurant can be very pricey and although the good is delicious, it's more of a special occasion kind of place for us.

The blue cheese dressing on the wedge salad is incredible.  The meatloaf is extraordinary with mashed potatoes.  The service is always friendly and knowledgeable about the menu and always make suggestions about the specials.  This is a great place to go and is very family friendly.

We have been to Bricktops several times.  It is nice, but overpriced.  The service each time has not been impressive, although the food is excellent.  The hostess was flat out rude on one visit.  Had we not been starving, we would have walked out.  Last week we sat on the patio for drinks and apps.  We waited and watched while another party was seated and attended to before us.  We had to go in the bar area and ask for a server.  The place was not crowded whatsoever as it was late afternoon.  Not sure if we will return.

This has to be one of the top restaurants in Charlotte. The food is always great and the staff is on point every time we dine here. (We sit at the bar almost every time).   The Bar staff is friendly and if we go to SouthPark we can count on a great time at Bricktops.
This place is just so good.  The service is the best in Charlotte--better than any of the fancy restaurants.

First time my wife and I had been to Bricktops...really enjoyed it!  We both had the ribs (they had been recommended) and they were very tender and tasteful.  Had the chocolate chip cookie dessert and it was fabulous!!  Also had the key lime pie but wasn't crazy about it.  The crust was a bit too dry with a strong nut flavor.

Brick Tops is my go-to place!! Right around the corner from where I live, my family loves to drive (or even walk) over for a relatively inexpensive, delicious meal. Last night, my sister and I  treated ourselves to the  grilled artichoke to start and then, per usual, I ordered the fish tacos. The blackened fish of the day was Mahi Mahi and paired with fresh guacamole, white cheddar and brown  rice, they were amazing. There is pretty much nothing on the menu that I wouldn't recommend. The people are super friendly and the service is speedy.

Great brunch! Started with the donut appetizer - the vanilla, chocolate and raspberry dipping sauces are great - but the donuts are also delicious without any sauce. I ordered the crab benedict and my husband ordered the chicken and waffle. As soon as noon rolled around the bartender brought out my Bloody Mary. I was disappointed that the only garnish was a lemon wedge, I'm a big fan of traditional (and creative) Bloody Mary toppings. Nonetheless, I enjoyed the mix (not sure if it's homemade.) My husband enjoyed his chicken and waffle, but had to remove a huge melting pond of butter from the middle of the waffle. My crab benedict was fantastic as well, well poached eggs atop an English muffin (homemade?) with a generous pile of lump crabmeat. I especially liked the hollandaise sauce which was particularly lemony, which complemented the crabmeat well. The roasted potatoes that came with the meal were perfectly cooked, soft insides and crispy outside with great seasoning. The food was a little on the pricey side, so we won't be regulars, but it was a terrific meal. Our server was a bit too nonchalant and actually left the wrong table's check with us at first, but everything came out as we ordered it and the food was delicious, so we'll overlook it.

This place has gotten a lot of bad reviews which surprises me a little.  I used to work within walking distance and it was my go to place for lunch when taking out clients... they were always impressed with the menu choices and decor.  I don't care what a restaurant looks like, but you know how clients are...  would rather have a pretty meal than a good one.    Just kidding, clients, love you forever!  Please keep sending me big checks!  By the way, have I told you that you look great today?  wink, wink...  On different occasions I have tried their crab salad, chicken sandwich, fish special, artichoke dip, calamari, and burger.  I found the food to be pretty good, simple and seasoned well.  I'm not a huge  fan of what the kids call "New American" food, but I thought this place was good.  Apologies if I am using the term incorrectly...   I have noticed that people give it good reviews for lunch and bad for dinner... may want to skip it at night.
Lunch on Friday was great. I think BrickTops has the best burger in town! Their food is great, always consistent and comes along with a friendly and efficient staff.

Made a reservation for Sunday brunch and went in pretty skeptical judging by some of the reviews. I was pleasantly surprised. We ordered the donuts for appetizer and it turned out the donut machine was having problems which was disappointing BUT the manager came by and said they would bring them to our table as dessert and it was on the house. Now that is the way to handle a restaurant issue. I digress, we ordered the french toast (three huge pieces with delicious caramelized bananas), eggs benedict, and shrimp and grits. They were all incredible. My only complaint is that we had to wait a while for the food but it was well worth it. Delicious meal.

The food is always amazing. The Palm Beach Salad is a longtime favorite because it's fresh and consistent. Crab, avocado, red onion, tomato, lettuce. The French dip is the most delicious steak sandwich. This time we had the Margherita Pizza which is thin, crunchy and tasty and the bread pudding is DELICIOUS.

After we worked around a slight attitude from the hostess, the manager did an excellent job seating us at a great table on the patio.  Rob was our server and he was excellent.  I had the Trout and it was excellent.

Excellent restaurant.  Never had even an average meal here...always top notch.  The burgers, the ribs, the Prime Rib, and that wonderful French Dip sandwich for lunch...oh man.  Hell even the chicken tenders are outta this world.  Shoulda went here today...

This was our third visit to Bricktops and I think we expected more. In the past we sat in the bar area but this time we tried the dining room area. The service was great both in the bar and dining area. Our server Adam was very attentive, friendly and gave recommendations which we appreciated. I ordered the recommended crab cakes and the bf ordered the tuna. The cakes were amazing as I was told they would be and the tuna just ok. The downfall for us is that we expected more food for the price we were paying.. next time we plan on sticking with their chicken tenders as they are always awesome.
Just a great place. Good menu, terrific service. We were there for a late lunch and enjoyed everything about it. Love the bar! We'll definitely be back

Hi there , just a writing a  short note had a wonderful time at Bricktop , fantastic service and the the ribs , were to die for ..... Thank you for all involve ... a truly memorable eating experience !!!!

Went with a friend for my birthday dinner and had a great time.  We really enjoyed the atmosphere.  We had spinach and artichoke dip w/ fresh tortilla chips to start and the real surprise was the fresh and flavorful salsa that came with it...yum!  The margherita flatbread was great for a lighter dinner option with fresh mozzarella and basil.  However, the real standout was the cheeseburger.  It seems they grind the meat for the burger themselves and it proved to be especially juicy and delicious.  The wait staff was friendly, very knowledgeable of the menu and offered great recommendations.  I will definitely go there again!
3 strikes and out. Tried it 3 times. Food has been mediocre to bad. Way overpriced

Excellent food, no -- excellent cuisine.  Excellent service -- well, except for paying the bill.    They don't accept Discover.  That's okay.  The wait-person came back with the check, after my attempt to pay with Discover, and curtly stated, "We don't take Discover," as he drops the card on the table.  Hmmm.    His dropping the card on the table must have been unintentional, as he and I discussed.  But after careful contemplation of the way he refused the Discover Card, I think it was a passive-aggressive act, although not a totally conscious one (perhaps).  Management, please take note.  After having expended the effort to write that, I'll be back to try another excellent meal.

I was initially excited about the opportunity to eat at such an establishment, considering the look, presentation, and huge crowd. But, after being told that the wait would be no more than one hour, we had to remind the hostess, on several occasions, that we had been waiting well past the original one hour promise. We were finally seated after waiting for more than an hour & a half. We were served by approximately 5 different waiters who never communicated which caused an array of problems for our table! My experience was one that I will probably never go back considering that there are several other options in the free world!

This place used to be good, but has really gone downhill. The last time we went there, we had to send back three things because they were wrong or just plain bad. Too bad because this used to be the closest thing to Houston's in Charlotte.
Visit Bricktop's at Specialty Shops on the Park for the best happy hour in town!

One of my favorites in Charlotte. Try the avacado and crab meat salad, it is a winner. Love the restaurant design, quiet, comfortable and wonderful service. The acoustics are great, allows for nice conversation.  all food items on the menu are excellent.

Bricktops does not disappoint!   I have been here twice within the last year, and I ordered the same thing each time:  Chicke fingers!!  Why?  Because they are the best in town!  Breaded to perfection, light and fluffy on the outside and juicy on the inside.   My side of sauteed spinach for both visits was awesome too!    Love  BTS location in the heart of SouthPark with a great patio, and welcoming decor.  Service is always top notch and good looking if I must confess!  Both of my recent visits were with large parties and the service never waivered each time.

Went here for lunch today. Really like the inside of this place. Nice decor and atmosphere. They have a really delicious app with sugar bacon and deviled eggs. Definitely a must. I had the grouper for my entree. Had the mac and cheese as a side. Pretty good, except maybe a bit too much cheese.  Very tasty fish. Would love to try more of the menu and sit outside on what looked like a nice patio.

This is a 4.75 star review.  I have had lunch and dinner at Bricktop's many times and have never been disappointed.  Please be aware however, I do not stray far from a few favorites on the menu.  Their veggie burger is the best I have had in Charlotte.  Their chicken tenders are also the best (no, I am not a 7 year-old child.)  Their salads, soup specials, and vegetable features are also top notch.  The deviled eggs and sugar bacon appetizer are VERY popular and delicious.  Where I dropped the review 0.25 stars is for price.  The restaurant is not the least expensive for lunch; BUT, in Southpark, nothing is inexpensive.  Parking availability is limited in front of the restaurant and additional parking is available throughout the retail area.  Where I am most impressed with Bricktop's is their service.  Granted, I am a regular, but I have always appreciated the teamwork of the professional servers.  It takes a village and Bricktop's has well-trained the Team to help each other.

This is my FAVORITE restaurant! We go here about once a week! My boyfriend love the bbq ribs and the sirloin. The palm beach salad and crab cakes are my favorites! They also have some of the best sushi!! I go here now to get sushi instead of an Asian restaurant, my favorites are the Hollywood roll and the Dragon roll. Yum!! They have a beautiful patio, that can be heated and closed in or open and cooled which is perfect in any weather! The patio is where i enjoy my favorite drink (a specialty cocktail of their's) the Rosemary Greyhound! So delicious - must try- everything is good here! & The food is always consistent!

Recently one of our PAK families at at Bricktop's. It is always wonderful to find a restaurant that is helpful with food allergies. "We have been to bricktops in South Park and they say they only use olive oil as a lot of ppl have allergies. They were wonderful with our 13 month old."
Great atmosphere.  Good mixed drinks and bar is of quality.  Food is on point   I'll come again!

Brunch at Bricktops is probably my favorite places to meet with friends on a Sunday. The food is delicious!! We usually come in right before 12 so we can be served a mimosa soon after arriving, but have also come in around 10:30 if We have a busy day planned. The deviled eggs are served with crispy bacon drizzled with syrup-incredible. They serve excellent guacamole, but not always on the menu ( might have to ask for it). I could go on, but bottom line is that I've not had anything that I didn't love while there for brunch.
Great atmosphere,awesome waitresses, and superior food!! Eating on the patio is best place

I always forget about this place and don't know why because I've always had good experiences here.  Went here last night with a group and tried almost every appetizer and they were all excellent.   They have a great bar and the "outdoor" patio area (which was closed in and heated) is a good place for a group to eat apps.  The waiters were always available and speedy getting drinks and food and were also patient with our large and loud group.

I visited Bricktop's located in the upscale Southpark area of Charlotte for the first time last night with a few coworkers. Based upon this single experience, I think I'm in love.  :)  The restaurant was crowded despite it being a weeknight. I was impressed with the service provided and absolutely loved the food. I experienced the deviled eggs and sugar bacon that previous reviewers raved about. Their analyses were not in vain. Additionally, I had the prime rib and twice baked potato for my dinner entree. The steak was cooked perfectly and the potato required no modification of spice/dressings.   The restaurant is moderately priced, with most entrees in the upper teens and twenty's. However, the drinks are a bit pricey. I ordered a pineapple martini for $10. It was good, but not great... at least not for the price.  Overall, I give this place a rare 5 thumbs up!  :)

Wasn't exactly sure what to expect, but was pleasantly surprised at how good everything was.  The spinach dip was so good someone at the table was licking the bowl with her fingers.   I had the meat loaf with mac and cheese side; lets say its the best I've had at any restaurant ever! Someone in my group ordered the fish tacos and they were really rood but the kale salad, maybe not so much. We all were happy with our meals.  Thank you!

Overall good food, albeit can be on the salty side if you are not careful (soup and tortilla chips), but they deserve recognition for their service and customer interaction.  After receiving the wrong order for takeout, we were invited back to correct the mistake, our credit card was credited, and they emailed us a $25 gift card to welcome us back.  This is a restaurant that is working hard to make their customers happy and with good food, we'll be back!

Was treated here for Mother's Day. It was horrible from seating, to service, to wine list, to entree'.  It was the worst waste of money spent in a long time!    The seats were outdoor plastic seats on the inside. Uncomfortable for sitting for dinner (ESP in white pants).   Our waitress disappeared halfway thru our meal and never returned. We had to ask the manager standing by the kitchen for refills and the bill.  No one checked on us after our meals were delivered.  And after all the "issues" and "poor service" we received a bill at full price!

For the longest time, I was under the impression that Bricktops was a pizza joint, albeit one of those "upscale" ones where they smother your wood-fired pizza with food stuffs that simply don't belong on a pizza. Salmon? Are you kidding me?   But I was mistaken, and gladly so. I was pleasantly surprised with Bricktops upon my first visit, and I've been there 3 times since. And each time I've eaten at Bricktops, my dining experience has been better than the previous time.   My first time, I popped my cherry there with a cheeseburger. I figure if you can't screw up a cheeseburger, then you're likely to know what you're doing in the kitchen. Bricktops passed this test with flying colors. One of the best cheeseburgers in town, no joke, and complimented pleasantly with a very generous serving of shoestring fries. First visit, color me impressed.  Second time around, my family and I dined there on New Year's Eve. A bit of trepidation surrounded my dining experience at first; I've been to several NYE dine-ins that have been nothing short of awful because of the importance of the holiday and a stunning lack of planning on a restaurant's management's part. But not at Bricktops. Reservations were honored without fail, our meal prepared with the utmost attention to detail and taste, and our waiter was very friendly and attentive, despite the buzz and the clamor in the air. I opted for the Parmesan Crusted Chicken, which was wonderful. Nothing beats chicken so tender you can fork it. My wife chose a New York Strip, Pittsburgh style, which she thought was very delicious. I sampled a couple of bites. Unbelievably tasty. My daughter loved her salmon and noodles, and for eating her plate clean, she was rewarded with a bowl of vanilla ice cream. Not just frozen, store-bought ice cream, but fresh-churned ice cream, the vanilla tasting of real vanilla bean. I can't say who enjoyed this more, my daughter or me.  Last visit there, I chose the veggie burger. Pardon my french, but HOLY SHIT, that is one spectacular veggie burger! Listen, just run there right now and try it. I guarantee you will not be disappointed.  A word about the Deviled Eggs & Sugared Bacon: what you've heard about this sinful delicacy is true. You can't just eat them. You find yourself DEVOURING them. Order a plate for you and your sweetie, and a fight for the last strip of bacon and the last sliced egg may break out, and it's gonna get ugly. So order two plates, one for you and one for him/her. Your relationship will be the better for it.  After 3 visits - and possibly a fourth coming this weekend - I can easily make the claim that Bricktops has become my favorite, go-to eatery in the Queen City, replacing my one-beloved 131 Main.
We really enjoy Bricktop.   Love the ribs and corn. They also have a great chicken recipe, although I can't recall the specific dish.  My only complaint is that service can sometimes me inconsistent.
Ribs, barbecue chicken flatbread, crab cakes, cast iron cookie.  Best in town
First time customer. I had the pan seared tuna and veggies. It was absolutely delicious. I highly recommend. Most definitely going to be a favorite place to eat.

My fish tacos were pretty good but overpriced for the two small tacos and spoonful of rice. My friend got the crab salad - it was tiny. Our waitress was not the best. She forgot the silverware - even after we got our salads. Had to ask twice for salad dressing. The girl that was filling up water glasses was trying to be cute but was just unbelievably rude. Next time I will go to Firebirds. On the plus side - the place is nicely decorated.

I loved the food here as did everyone else I was with.  We ordered a few appetizers-the deviled eggs, pizzas, etc.  Everything was delicious!! The bacon that came on the side with the deviled eggs was to die for! I ordered the ahi tuna salad and I ate every single bite.  It was perfect--light and refreshing.  The tuna was seared to perfection!! Everyone was happy with their food as well--ranging from steaks to lamb to other salads.  The wines we ordered were delicious as well!  The service was excellent :)
Hard to find good prime rib in Charlotte, but their prime rib is great. Fantastic food and desserts, Bricktops never disappoints.

Bricktop's is tucked away behind SouthPark Mall a block away from where you think it is. -- To wit: not behind Walgreen's. Any time I go west on Morrison from Sharon, I'm heading to the Mall and turn left before I get to 6401. Heaven forbid you should go to Bojangle's instead! (shudder!)   I entered in the mood for a cheeseburger and I successfully resisted the temptation of a very good-looking menu.  But oh! What a burger! I was told by our waiter that since they ground their own beef, I could get it close to the rare the nanny state won't allow us to have.  It came to the table in like two minutes, dripping with hot, juicy deliciousness. So juicy, in fact, that it soaked the bun into a soggy, doughy mess. Halfway through, I discarded the remains of a once-crispy toasted bun and finished off the piece of cow with my fork.  Friends, that cow died a noble death in a worthy cause.  Even the humble French Fries were remarkably tasty. I'm a light eater and usually get two meals from any restaurant. Not this time. I almost whacked our waiter's knuckles when he politely reached to remove my plate. I was sitting, talking, sipping, and enjoying the feeling of being comfortably full, but still nibbling at my fries.  Rita had the deviled eggs and sugar bacon. The eggs were good, but the bacon was de-freakin-licious!  The drinks were strong and plentiful. My wife's favorite pet peeve is a Martini that only fills half the glass. A cheap bar will short you two thirds of a drink that way. Any place that serves you a third of a Martini is probably cheating you other ways, too. This one was full to the brim and frosted.  My rum and Coke was strong enough to rise up and walk across the table by itself. The well liquors are good, too. No need to call.  Our servers, trainer and trainee, were never more than a glance away. As he walked through the dining area, his eyes would track right and left. We were always able to catch his eye.   I hate giving five stars! I really do. But they didn't do anything wrong!  I'll be back to give them a chance to lower their score. That's fair . . . right?

Went here for a company lunch and all the food was delicious. It was pricey and I thought the appetizer portions were very small for the price. Also was disappointed they don't serve bread before the meal. Other than that, the food was spectacular. I tried lots of appetizers - tempura shrimp, spinach artichoke dip, and candied bacon were amazing. I had fish tacos with mahi mahi and they were to die for. The fish melted in my mouth. Peach Bellini was good, Mac and cheese was amazing, chocolate chip cookie and gingerbread were all perfect. Food was some of the best I've had. This place only lost points for no bread and small portion size for appetizers.

This review is 100% based on 2 separate interactions with bartender, Mike. I hope the owners are aware of what a gem they have in this employee and treat him accordingly. After living in Charlotte for a couple years there are only a couple standouts and I'm grateful to have found Bricktop's and met Mike. Spent an amazing afternoon on Christmas Day most recently (thank you for being like the only place open) and it was a pleasure to feel at home because of Mike. Will definitely be back to see him!

Went for mid-week lunch and was impressed how many waitstaff on hand. Host was very friendly. Order put in quickly and food served promptly. Drink refills a little slower than preferred, but everything else very good. Will return!

I'm not big on writing reviews but when you have a meal this superb it's hard not too! Everything I ate was absolutely fantastic, full of flavor and well worth any amount. Granted, I did dine during restaurant week which meant 4 courses for $30. But I would and will gladly come back as often as I can! The meal started with Tomato soup, followed by their sausage flatbread. Both were perfectly portioned and left me excited about what was next. The Ribs were fall off the bone tender, and sides of mac and creamed spinach were the perfect compliments. At this point were both stuffed and fully satisfied when the best looking skillet chocolate chip cookie EVER was sat in front of us. It's hard not to make room and it was worth every painful bite!   Considering it was a very busy time for the restaurant our experience there did not suffer one bit. We arrived on time for our reservation and were immediately taken to our seats. Our server was on her game and they even worked as a team to ensure every guest needs were taken care of. If you had any doubts about this place before, hopefully I can ease your mind by saying go and experience this place for yourself. You won't regret it!

Not sure if it was a bad night but everything was terrible including the service. The "millionaire's" bacon was burned. The grilled artichoke over cooked. The $16 "sushi" roll looks like it came from Harris Teeter. Most disturbing was how terrible the service was. This was once a go-to place but now it is off the list. Don't waste your time or money here

Amazing place! I must start by saying that the Rosemary Grapefruit Soda there is the  BEST SODA I HAVE EVER HAD IN MY ENTIRE LIFE!!!!!!!! I recommend it to any and everyone! The atmosphere is nice, not very french ( and I've been to france). There are big bottles of Veuve Clicquot in the front when you walk in, very inticing. The first time I visited, i went for lunch. I take a late lunch ( around 2 pm) and they were still a little busy and a little slow. But my waitor was great and I scored some free fries! They were great, "skinny', just the way I like them. I ordered the roasted chicken (half chicken) wich was about 16$ and I ate on it for days. It was seasoned well and juicy. The jus was sooooo good. I had spinach as my side which had a smokey flavor to it and parmasean (I think). My lunch guest had the salmon with spincah...Amazing, flavorful, and moist. The second time I visited was for brunch. Saldy, they were out of blood orange mimosas. So I opted for the Rosemary Grapefruit soda. Amazing choice. We started with the donuts that came with three dipping sauces. Chocolate, Raspberry, and Creme Anglaise (my fav!). They were delicious!! I ordered the French Toast with caramelized bananas, whipped cream and a side of bacon. Huge portion!! My guest orded Steak and Eggs, she said it was cooked perfectly. And of course we had frites!!! I will definitely be visiting this place again.
This is my go too, kick ass service at the bar, not a huge menu, but all the items kick ass
Tuna was cooked perfectly.  Ribs were fall off the bone, but a little dry. Good slaw.

I went with a group of 8. We were seated quickly. The wait staff was superb. Although the place was full, it was quiet enough that we could hear each other. I had the fish tacos.  They were excellent...the best I ever have had!  I am adding this place into my rotation of go to restaurants!

I went to Bricktops. I don't know if I went on an off night, but for as much as I paid for my meal , I expected better service. During my meal a waitress came out with a salad that she thought we ordered, but wasn't ours. She then proceeded to go to the next table and I overheard the man tell her that he didn't want it now that his entree had already come out. The next incident was my meal came out, but not my boyfriends. The waitress walked by and said she would be right back to go check on it. It took 10 more minutes for his to come out after mine had already been served. My food was not hot. It came out luke warm. Although the food was tasty there are too many negative things that happened tonight for me to want to go back to this restaurant and spend the kind of money We spent. The restaurant wasn't even busy.

Seems to be a popular place with business types so is popular around lunch time, but when you sit down the staff will be extremely friendly and skilled. I got the steak and fries and was very good, albeit not quite as hot as I'd like but not cold. If they have the twice baked potato I'd recommend it as it is excellent.
Steak cooked perfectly. Apps and dinner were both delicious. Next time I'm back in NC, I know where I will be eating !

Went to Bricktop's for our Anniversary. We were looking for a nice meal and a long conversation. When we arrived, we were concerned with the noise because of a significant number of families, but when we were seated, we had a nice table in the back of the restaurant.   The only negative of the restaurant was parking.   Everything else was incredibly positive.   Nice pace from the server. Never rushed. Never wondering where he was.   Had the Beet/Goat Cheese Salad - split it (no additional charge). It was very nice and light.   My wife had the filet and creamed spinach.   I had the NY Strip and Fettuccine Alfredo.   Then, we split a baked potato...  Wow...we were so excited about the food. My wife said it was the best steak she had eaten in some time.   We ended our meal with the bread pudding. I've had bread pudding all over the world. This was among the best. The sauce and the creme anglaise were perfect. What an ending to a great evening.   It's noisy, but just enough so that you don't think people can hear your conversation.   It's casual enough to feel comfortable, but nice enough for our anniversary.   We will return.

Bricktops was an all around disappointment!   Cold mac and cheese and broccoli. They did bring some back piping hot, but this time they were both overcooked. The broccoli could have fallen of the stem.   The initial bite of the mashed potatoes seemed pretty good, but had a strange unbecoming lasting flavor.    My friend ordered the Trout with fries. She said it was ok and the fries were the best part of her meal.   The Cream of corn - for me, was practically the only saving grace to this place.   The manager Jamie Stegall, was very apologetic. Also a saving grace to the whole experience! She was sweet and offered to bring anything else with no cost. She sweetly packed up some cream of corn to go with her card to receive a free dessert the next time I come.

We had a really good group dinner at Bricktop's.  Even for a group of 16, the service was attentive and prompt.  Our reserved table was ready for us and we were seated on time.  Our appetizers, tempura shrimp and deviled eggs, were very good.  The shrimp was perfectly fried and the dipping sauce had a great taste.  The real treat was the entrees.  I had the chicken, creamy mashed potatoes, and sautéed spinach.  All cooked perfectly and very tasty.  The deserts were also very good.  I am very glad we tried Bricktop's.  With it being so close to my job and home, it is a great spot.  I look forward to bringing my wife back.  It was a really good meal.

My good friend took me out for my birthday today. She loves Brick Top and I have never been - check, check. We went in between lunch and dinner, so no wait.  The restaurant is beautiful. The bar itself is nice sized, and the service es muy bueno.  We had a great server!  We skipped appetizers this go around. But two things caught my eye - the deviled eggs and millionaires bacon, and the goat cheese flatbread - maybe on my next visit.  I had the blackened fish tacos and they were yummy! My friend had the Thai steak salad, I didn't taste it, but it smelled heavenly. And she got the kale and spinach side. It too smelled heavenly and the taste did not disappoint. I will try to recreate that dish for dinner. I think it will spice up my spinach. I noticed the grapefruit rosemary soda. I'm not a fan of grapefruit, but this item made me wish I was. My friend got it, and she loved it. So I have to put my thinking cap on. What fruit can I mix with rosemary infused simple syrup and make into a soda.  I would go again and I would recommend it.

I have nothing bad say about my experience here. But did I think the whole experience was worth the $130 for 2? Not really. I had the filet mignon, it was PERFECTLY cooked, (md. rare) and a great glass of wine, but I'll look for some place else when we visit Charlotte again.

Sunday brunch met my expectations. The doughnut appetizer is served with a trio of sauces: raspberry, chocolate and creme anglaise. The doughnuts were really nice. My mom makes just as good or better, but these are still worth it.   The Bel Air Benedict comes with a thick sliced tomato, a good amount of fresh avocado and a poached egg on an English muffin and topped with hollandaise. The hollandaise was a bit thick and not lemony enough for my taste, and the egg was cooked a little too much (most of the yellow was hard), but overall the combination of flavors worked.  The home fries served with the Benedict were salty and seasoned and crispy.   The French Toast with caramelized bananas and maple syrup was the perfect sweet counterbalance to the Eggs Benedict. I appreciated that the syrup was real maple and the butter was real butter. (Sad how often that is not the case.) If possible, I recommend sharing 2 dishes to get the best of savory and sweet.

Excellent brunch for our party! The pluses of this restaurant is how they can have great service and good food, and a fair price point. We had a big group with a variety of people--foodies to meat/potato people. Bricktops pleased everyone with their menu options for brunch--breakfast or lunch choices. My favorite is the fish tacos and you can change the side to one of their veggies or do the fries. I have also tried the warm chocolate chip cookies for dessert & they're scrumptious! Reservations recommended.

Let's start by saying YUM!! I've been here a few times and each time has been delicious!  My first visit to Bricktops was last year during restaurant week and I was hooked! Unlike most restaurant during restaurant week, you can actually choose from any entree on the menu for the $30 price.  The deviled eggs with sugar bacon appetizer changed my life! The sugar bacon is more like candied bacon...sweet, savory, and amazingly delicious! I could come here and only get the sugar bacon. I normally order the New York strip cooked medium which is prepared perfectly each time. The wait staff is friendly and attentive without being annoying.  They lost a start because they're serving flat soda! My last visit I order a coke and sent it back twice. Finally I requested water and told the waitress the coke was flat. She replied with yeah, we've been having issues with that for a while now. For some reason she charged me $2.50 for a flat soda I didn't drink!! The waitress was apologetic about the soda charge and corrected the bill immediately.

I polled a few people and everyone agreed: Bricktop's sounds like a pizza place.  Having never been to Bricktop's, we decided to give it a try this past Saturday evening.  It was nicely decorated inside with a modern, upscale vibe, but comfortable enough that you could still dress casual (but not too casual).  We didn't have a reservation, but we were seated within 10-15 minutes.    The menu is basically "American" food; there didn't appear to be any other theme to it.  We started out with the deviled eggs and sugar bacon appetizer, only because it sounded unique and certainly not something you see every day on a menu.  The eggs were good, but nothing special about them.  The sugar bacon was basically dessert for us.  Wow.   Tasty, but oh-so-sweet.    None of the entrees -- basic steaks, chicken, fish -- really jumped out at me, so I went with the Ahi Tuna Burger.  It was quite a fabulous sandwich, topped with a ginger dressing slaw (lettuce, carrots; no cabbage thankfully).  It was full of flavor, and I enjoyed every bite.  I chose fries as my side item, and they were thin slices of fried potato with a delicious coating.  I enjoyed them, too!  It was a good dinner experience and I'd recommend it for people who like a great meal but don't like anything too crazy food-wise.  I'd call it a nice "meat and potatoes"-type restaurant.

Amazing place! I went there yesterday without a reservation and the wait were 25min. Food is excellent, nice entrees and great service. If you like fish, you definitely should try the Dove sole meunière. It was so delicious!!!

Great ambiance! The decor is very nice and romantic. We went for Valentine's day and from the start things were a little sketchy. We had reservations for 2 at 8. We arrived and the hostess seated us, but we passed 9 empty tables before she sat us in the back. As I was seated I realized they had all people of color in this one little section. WTH  The food was good I had grilled lobsters French fries and cole slaw. DO NOT GET THE COLE SLAW. Crab cakes were delicious also.
Christmas Dinner outing with my infamous book club, great wait staff. Robert was our waiter. Great food. Large portions. Parking could be a little hectic on a busy evening. Will be back.

This was my first time going to Bricktops and I was very impressed.    The inside was classy and upscale.  We went during lunch on a Saturday, there was no wait and they were moderately busy.  The servers were wearing their Panthers gear l assume for the weekend.  We ordered the spinach and artichoke dip as an app, it was average.  I let the BF pick, honestly I wanted to check out the deviled eggs after all the reviews. Our entrees were the Palm Beach salad and a regular cheeseburger.   Oh my goodness, it was delicious! I had the palm beach salad, the presentation was beautiful I felt bad destroying it. I wish I had a pic to show.  It came with crab, shrimp, avocado, tomato and eggs. Very refreshing.  My BF ordered the cheeseburger, of course I sampled it.  The fries were amazing.  Not sure why they stole the show but they did.  They were better than hot fresh salted McDonald's fries.  I highly recommend those.  And for dessert we ordered the chocolate chip cookie. It was very rich.  A skillet baked cookie with ice cream and caramel sauce.  Also, on a side note I had the coffee with dessert too, it was very memorable. Very strong.  That may have been one of my favorite things.   I enjoyed Bricktops & would return.  Service was great, food was great.  The only concern was the price, it was on the pricey side, but you get what you pay for, right?!?
Pretty good/consistent fare but a touch expensive for one notch above average food.  $16-$20 salads are a bit much. Steak Frites were good but not great.
Food was just ok. They forgot to serve our salads first. Everything came to the table at once. Seen a roach on the wall crawling towards me. So gross. Server was very nice. Probably won't return.

Wandering about trying to find a place to have a drink and this was the winner. Nice big bar and opened up to the outdoor patio. Very nice and inviting. The place was crowded and I order my standard dirty martini. Bartender Sasha was right on, my tini was made to perfection. She gave us a menu and things did seem pricey but on par with most others. I just felt like drinking and had a 2nd when I spotted the Key Lime Pie and had to have a piece. They brought out this huge piece of pie and I was a happy boy. The first bite made me even happier. It was a case of come near me or touch this pie and we will have issues. Delicious. Between my martini and the pie it was perfect evening. Next time I may have to try some food, but I will have my pie first! Great service, nice atmosphere a must stop.
They have sushi and shoestring fries. Enough said. Generous pours, comfortable bar, etc. Did I mention you can have sushi and french fries?!

I had the pleasure of visiting this restaurant for a work dinner function and was very pleasantly surprised of the quality of food and service here. I had the Florida grouper and it was cooked perfectly - just right so it was not dry. The key lime pie was a little different than the traditional style but still quite tasty. Hope to return next time I am here.

At the suggestion of my boss we came here for a lunch with a couple of other coworkers. I had never heard of this place and I've lived in Charlotte my entire life. Anyways after the hostess tried to sit 4 grown adults in a small booth we were seated in the main dining room. That was really the only hiccup of the day.   We arrived around 11:45 before the lunch rush, which if you come after 12:15 expect to wait. I ordered the steak and fries. That was probably the best decision I made all day. The steak was amazing. It had a garlic butter on it, and the steak for lack of a better term was butter. OMG. I picked at my fries, but wanted to save all the room for the steak. M. Steak.   Granted, if I was paying I probably wouldn't have picked the steak. For lunch it is a little pricey, but on the companies' tab I will take it all day.

We went there on a whim because we were too early for Rooster's brunch. Food was excellent, I had the ABLT and my fiancé had creole shrimp, both very fresh and filling. OJ was fresh squeezed and service was super friendly. We will put them on the rotation for Sundays.

This restaurant is amazing! I've been here three times and can officially say it's my favorite place to dine in Charlotte. The food is amazing every time. Please try the salmon, steak, trout with lump crab meat, deviled eggs. You cannot go wrong with any of these. The staff was very kind, polite and we had the perfect server. He gave excellent service and was incredibly accommodating. Love this place! Already planning my next visit!

This was my favorite restaurant in town until last night.  Went for my birthday dinner very early 5:45.  There were lots of booths open and we were offered the worst one.  (Why do they do that? Give the first diners a great seat please!!)    Ordered a salad and it was swimming in dressing which I would have asked the waitress to replace if she'd come back around.  She didn't, so I ate it. I used to love the TROUT with capers and lemon butter.  The trout now has crab and brown butter.  It was over cooked and dry (no sauce). I wouldn't order it again. We never saw the waitress until she offered dessert.  One guy dropped off water but the service was lacking.  If it wasn't my birthday I would have asked for the manager.   Soooo disappointed! Spouses salmon and spinach were great as always.
Had lunch here, fabulous food. Have to try the deviled eggs, they are a little sweet but so addictive. Everything was wonderful! Great service too!

We had a nice meal here tonight. For restaurant week, its 4 courses for $30. I had the caesar salad, sausage flatbread, baby back ribs and bread pudding. Mrs. Dining A had the soup, deviled eggs, crab cakes and ice cream. The ribs, flatbread, deviled eggs and crab cakes were all awesome. Sides of mac n cheese, fries and kale/quinoa were all very good too.  4.5 stars for food. 3 stars for service, which was efficient but rushed. For $30, this is a very very solid deal. We even had quite a bit of leftovers to take home. I'm giving this 5 stars overall though, for the price. It would feel a little pricey outside of restaurant week.

Pretty good place for brunch. I go here just for the candied bacon and deviled eggs. Not too fond of some of the other items I've had here. It's hit or miss sometimes with the way it is prepared. A few times I've ended up with soggy food or really poorly made latte.

Perfection!  The food was excellent, booth seating is extremely cool, the bar is gorgeous.  We had the grilled artichoke appetizer and for lunch, the jumbo chunk crab cakes which were heavenly and the "upscale" chicken strips which were prepared tempura-style, light and fluffy.    There are definitely things I could pick on, such as the lack of a true chocolate-based dessert, but they are minor flaws.  And they went above and beyond with detail such as having the nicest bathrooms of any venue in Charlotte.   Will definitely be back!

Enjoyed fresh sea bass and sautéed spinach after a delicious Caesar salad. The salad was a generous side salad with home made dressing - just the right balance to make this common salad very interesting.  The main course was delivered hot from the kitchen with the fresh fish cooked perfectly, especially for the thickness of the choice cut. The sautéed spinach was delicious too with lemon zest and a hint of garlic. My friend enjoyed the Scottish salmon and was equally impressed with his dinner.  Bricktop's offers a consistently great dinning experience.

One of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte --- seriously. Do yourself a favor and head there right now. We always make it here during the Queen's Feast/Restaurant Week. This time, we took a newbie friend with us, and she said "how have I never been here before ... this place is amazing!"  For appetizers: you absolutely have to get the deviled eggs & millionaire's bacon. The eggs are probably some of the best in the South, and the bacon is basically candied/glazed ... all the NOMS.  Entrees: My go-to is without a doubt the baby back ribs. They're so tender they just drop right off the bone. You get a huge rack, probably about 12 bones or so. More than enough. The ribs come with fries & cole slaw. I'm not a huge slaw fan, so I always sub it out. GET THE MAC N' CHEESE. Seriously, it's insanely good. The crab cakes are also amazing --- great size and huge chunks of fresh crab. My wife and I didn't really care for the quinoa-kale salad too much that it came with ... but to each their own. You can't go wrong ordering either of this. My wife and I usually get these and split our dinners to get the best of both worlds. If you're more of a chicken person, the Parmesan crusted chicken is incredible and the service size is insane ... easily two meals worth.   Alright, stop reading and make your reservations now!

What really bummed me out about Brick tops is that by listening to the server across from us we were expecting really great service, but our server failed us. For me, dining out is an entire experience not just the food. The food was great, I orders ahi tuna, my fiancé ordered a burger. I really wish our server had made a better impression of what Brick tops is really about.

Never heard of the place so me and my wife decided to go there last night and I have to say it was awesome. We both loved the deviled egg w/the sugar bacon. My wife does't usually eat bacon but she loved it. The prices are reasonable with what they give b/c i order ribs and they never asked me if i wanted a half or full, they gave me a full rack. The chocolate chip cookie desert was awesome. I recommend going to this place.

This is misleading. The price range for this restaurant should really be $$$ because everything was rather expensive. I looked this place up for brunch but we didn't get a brunch menu and it wasn't past noon yet. The food was excellent however, it is kind of an upscale restaurant which my husband and I weren't aware of and showed up in jeans and t shirts while everyone was definitely in business clothing. That was awkward but the staff was still nice to us even though we stuck out like a sore thumb.

I have a lot of friends that rave about Bricktop's and I had never been, so recently when I found myself in SouthPark around lunch time, I decided to meet a friend there.  I was worried because there were a lot of people milling around the hostess stand when I arrived.  However, I was able to get a table right away.   I ordered the Ahi Tuna salad which consisted of seared rare Ahi tuna, mixed greens, red onion, fresh mango and a citrus vinaigrette. At $17 for lunch, this is not a cheap salad, but it was good.    Our service was fine on this visit, and while I doubt I would go out of my way to come here frequently, I would certainly eat here again if I happened to be in the neighborhood.

Went last week and now remember why we hadnt been back in a long time.  Went for a birthday party for relatives .  My food was cold when they finally brought it out.  I ask to have it heated and it fianlly came back about the time everyone else was about finished.  NUKED and over done.  GUESS WHO WONT BE GOING BACK.  No offer to comp even after I complained the second time and they could see I wasnt going to eat it.

Yummy...a little shopping and then some dinner.  This is my neighbors favorite restaurant and after hearing her rant and rave about it - the boyfriend and I finally decided to stop on in.  it's conveniently located across from Southpark mall and has a lot of seating indoor and outdoor. The menu is American with a nice selection of seafood and beef.  Carpaccio is by far my favorite appetizer that exists and Bricktops did not disappoint the Filet Mignon was top notch.  I opted for a salad for my meal and was very pleased with my selection - lump crab meat, shrimp, avocados this girl could not have been happier.  Oh and I can't remember what night I went but they had $6 martini's - of course at that price how could I resist a dirty martini  with blue cheese stuffed olives oh yeah baby. Next stop I will try their brunch :)

Incredible food. Amazing service. Everything was perfect, the NY strip Steak, the lobster bisque, and the chocolate chip cookie/ice cream desert were all exquisitely made and prepared. Our server, Jason, was friendly and helpful. I'm very tempted to stop back here at some point to try the key lime pie as well.

Great dinner st Bricktops tonight!  Even more amazing than the food was the scene we witnessed.  There was a gentleman at the bar who had clearly had too much to drink.  The staff at Bricktops swung into action led by Katarina, the bartender and totally supported by the entire staff. They repeatedly, and respectfully, asked him if he was driving...volunteering to call a cab.  He said he was walking, but they followed him out to the parking lot to make sure.  When it appeared he was looking for his car, they convinced him to come back in. They called s cab and put him safely inside.  Patron is safe and Charlotte drivers are safe.  Heard them say their GM is in the hospital. No worries, your restaurant is in excellent hands.  And we will be back.

It's a little fancy pantsy...Pretentious. White table cloths. However, even though I didn't feel like I fit in much, the food was legit. I had grouper with crab the the lobster bisque was pretty good. I'd go back.

hello heaven...who knew you were here on earth in the form of fabulous food & perfect corner booth ambiance?   i ventured to bricktops on thursday for a lunch meeting and while the company was good, my main takeaway (as it has been in the past) was feeling impressed with my overall dining experience.  greeted upon arrival by hostess, ushered immediately to our booth, greeted shortly thereof by a server who shared the daily features, drinks delivered & refilled in a timely fashion and finally the food.  i went with the grilled steak salad fresh vine ripe tomatoes, blue cheese crumbles with a vinaigrette dressing - others went with the flatbread,  french fries and even blackened fish tacos - we left feeling comfortably full and satisfied with our meals.  while the variety is good, i still feel like the prices are just a tad too high - but maybe the covers the rest of the experience? this remains on my list of definite go to spots in southpark.

I ate here for Sunday bunch. We got the Deviled egg appetizer. It was delicious! For my entrée I got a French dip. I was very disappointed by it!  It was extremely fatty and very chewy. I've been there several times and this was the first time I was Disappointed. No French Dip for me next time.

Had brunch here a couple of weeks ago and I was not very impressed with the food on this visit.  The restaurant itself is very nice, cozy and clean and the service was just great.  We ordered the blackened fish tacos, grilled chicken sandwich, and a kid's meal and everything was just 'ok'.  I guess I was looking for more as I've heard lots of good things about this place and it's no doubt popular as they were overflowing with folk trying to get in......perhaps I'm missing something so I will give them another try at some point.

I went in and ordered the cookie dessert.  It is brought out on a hot skillet.  The chocolate chip cookie is on the bottom with a scoop of vanilla ice cream and caramel drizzled all over.  When biting into the cookie it tasted like a homemade cookie.  It was soft and melted in your mouth.  The cookie wasn't over cooked at all.  The ice cream adds a cold mix to the hot cookie.  The caramel is a perfect topping because it doesn't make the dessert to chocolaty.  The desert cost about $6 and it is worth every penny.  The service is great and I would recommened going to Bricktops, there flat bread pizza, hand made veggie burgers and fries are all really good.

went for brunch. donuts delicious, small bites made to order and with three different dippings (chocolate, strawberry, cream), popcorn shrimps nice and crispy but there were not "whole" shrimps inside, just small pieces. crab cakes Delicious, fresh, tasty, moist enough and well cooked outside. Fries were also Super good, the cut is the fine one, which is my favorite.  The place is casual, large comfortable tables with sofa, diner style but more elegant.

The deviled eggs with the millionaire's bacon was insane! Best deviled eggs and bacon EVER! We got the chicken and waffles and it was really good. The drinks were REALLY strong and tasty. We will definitely be back. Our waitress was really good as well. This is probably one of the best brunch places in Charlotte.

Very enjoyable. We had a party of eight on a weeknight (with a reservation), and the restaurant was bustling. After a starter of deviled eggs and "millionaire's bacon", I had a full rack of baby back ribs with French fries and cole slaw. The sauce had a nice peppery kick to it... good stuff, especially with the slaw and a local beer. My wife ordered gluten-free for health reasons, but when her plate came out it was obviously not right since there were breaded onions on it. The manager quickly took it back and (we think) they prepared a whole new meal for her. It took a while, but to their credit, Bricktops did it right. We would gladly return, and I'd probably go for the ribs again!
I have continued to be impressed with the food and service here.  I would definitely recommend Bricktops.  When I have gone with the kids they were very family friendly which I did not expect!

What happened! This is not the Bricktop's I have enjoyed in the past. There with another couple 6/26/14, looking for a long-overdue catch-up and pleasant evening.   Our initially friendly waiter turned out to be incompetent...or perhaps it was the combined team? Salads arrived before appetizers. Appetizers arrived a few minutes later, crowding the table. Entrees arrived 1 minute after the appetizers. We obviously sent entrees back, where they must have sat under a warmer until served. Ribs were okay but luke warm and broccolini was hard as a rock. To top it off, the waiter came running after us outside the restaurant accusing us of failing to sign both receipts. We encouraged him to go back and check...where he ultimately found both and gave a weak apology. This while other diners leaving the restaurant glared at us.  It will be LONG time before we return.

I enjoyed the food, especially my fish tacos entree.  The brown rice was inventive and a tasty accompaniment.  The atmosphere was great for a casual date or decent meal after Southpark, especially if you are trying to avoid the chains (Cheesecake, Maggianos, CPK, etc).  Looking forward to trying more things here.

One of my favorites in town for consistently good quality food. Went there Friday for restaurant week with my wife and another couple and we all love it.  The seared scallop on the country ham grits were fantastic. I have gotten the parmesan chicken on several occasions and it's wonderful as well. The deviled eggs are as good as advertised.  Plus the location is cool and comfortable.  A winner.
I love going to bricktops for brunch on Sundays. The chicken and waffles are so good. They are seasoned well. They also have good potatoes for brunch
Without question THE best ribs in Charlotte! Absolutely amazing! The French Dip is also incredible as well.

We had our bachelorette dinner here at Bricktops.  There was a group of 14 of us and they were able to accommodate us with only a days notice for reservation as we had to make unexpected change in plans.  The service was great and everyone really loved their meals. Several got fillets and all said they were great! I can recommend the lobster bisque and the meatloaf. So yummy!

It's upscale yet approachable. The presentation of the food wins you over as soon as it gets to your table, but the taste seals the deal. The flavor deal. I hear you have to try the bread pudding; that's next on my to-eat list. I was too full for dessert this time around!
The food is great, the greater thing is you can always see Charlotte basketball player and football player, football team's owner dining there too!

I have been to Bricktops three times and each time gets better than the last.  This restaurant is very popular with a great vibe, great food, and friendly service.    To save you time, start with the deviled eggs appetizer.  I ordered the eggs because I have never seen a restaurant brave enough to add a dish that is best remembered from a church potluck - what's next ... tater Tots casserole?  However, I was rewarded not only with tasty eggs, but with a candied bacon (they call millionaire's bacon) that literally had me fighting my clients for the last piece.  We also ordered the Shangri-la roll which is a combination a spicy roll, a California roll, and a rainbow roll.  I don't care what you combine as long as it is delicious.  The last two times I have ordered the Chilean Sea Bass with a miso soy marinade.  You can't go wrong here and it is buttery as the best sea bass I have had, but my table mates steaks also looked amazing.  We finished off with a chocolate chip cookie which is served warm in a cast iron pan with some ice cream on top.  Definitely check out Bricktops if you can get a table.

While visiting Charlotte, I had lunch on Monday March 20, with my wife and two long time friends. Brick Top's is an upscale restaurant in the South Park area of Charlotte. The ambiance was sleek modern and very tasteful. My wife and I shared a Tempura shrimp. It was very tasty and more than adequate for sharing. We also each had grilled salmon salad. The salmon was well prepared but the salad itself was pedestrian, nothing interesting. All in all a pleasant but not special experience.

Their waffles are excellent. I'm not sure what they do- perhaps Crack- but they were the best waffles ever.   The only reason for three stars is the lack of brunch options. This man cannot live on waffles alone- even epically awesome waffles.

This is another long overdue review! Bricktops is one of my hubs and I go to places in Charlotte, as we're never disappointed! We have had date night, large group and group parties and celebrations here. Our friends & family now love Bricktops too! I hate that they no longer participate in restaurant week BUT we are still always in this place lol. Crab cakes are the BEST in town and I've had my share around Charlotte, no one comes close. I've tried many things on the menu and have not had one bad or disappointing item yet. Bricktops staff is GREAT and accommodating, especially when we do surprise group dinners (they'll keep the cake and the secret).   I recently chose to celebrate a new job at a close by restaurant (just to try it). After we were seated and experienced poor & slow service...my husband called Bricktops and they got us in within 15 minutes AND it was later in the evening (with a party of 8). Needless to say my whole crew up and left place 1 and enjoyed a wonderful dinner/experience at Bricktops!

Now THIS was a very pleasant surprise! I don't know why I expected a yucky chain restaurant. This was more "upscale" than I expected. In fact my date thought she was underdressed in her "designer sweatpants" but in reality she wasn't. LOL. I had on my staple shorts and T.....but on the "dressier" side...if that makes sense?  We started with the Deviled Eggs and Sugar Bacon. GOD was that awesome! There was definitely a sugar component to the egg filling, and it matched perfectly with the sugar bacon which was scrumptuous.  We both got a version of their supposedly FRESH Ahi Tuna, which the waitress said was flown in almost daily. Having lived on the West Coast I'm somewhat spoiled in what I expect out of Ahi Tuna. Well this was the real deal....as far as EAST Coast "fresh" Tuna goes. The quality was excellent, and the sear was perfect. Loved those sessame seeds on the oustside. My date's salad was very tasty as well, with the same tuna (albeit smaller in size).  No wine today. Just water. But overall a really excellent dinner experience. I will definitely be coming back!

This restaurant is excellent! My husband and I went for restaurant week and we were not disappointed. All of the food was well prepared and presented nicely. I had the lobster bisque soup, artichoke and spinach dip and crab cakes and fries. My husband had the lobster bisque soup as well, sausage flatbread, and ribs. Neither one of is could pin point our favorite because everything was so great. The service was wonderful as well, everyone was friendly and our waiter was very attentive. The restaurant has a nice decor as well. I really like that fact that we were not  rushed with our food. We had time to enjoy dish without the next one being brought out. I would definitely recommend this place and will be going back!

Bricktops is a solid go-to for a nice dinner out, but still in a casual setting. The service is always great and the food never disappoints. The wine selection is very good as well. I recommend the prime rib, filet and crab cakes! Can't wait to go back again!

It was grandparent's day which brought on taking the 11 & 8 year oldsters to lunch.  We chose Bricktop's and this is certainly a classy and well run restaurant for lunch and dinner, as well as group events.  Bricktop's has that modern wood and glass restaurant off of a very sizeable bar.  A covered and heated sun porch is just off of the bar.  Booths are comfortable and there are also table seating and nice stools along the bar.  I will risk saying that it has a masculine feel, but not stuffy old school masculine.  Women will appreciate the classiness of the place.  Wait staff are wearing white shirts with ties along with long aprons.  Adds to the class.  Wife and I really did like the lunch menu.  It was full of dinner kind of items, along with sandwiches and salads. There was grouper, crab cakes, Ahi steak, salmon and trout for sea-foods.  Ribs, steak chicken entrees.    Appetizers were pretty neat.  Nice selection of items different from the stuffed jalapenos or mozzarella sticks.  Wife and I had grilled artichokes, three half's, with a dynamite aioli dip.  Heaven.  I had the lobster roll which was delicious and not skimpy on lobster meat.  And wife had a meaty French Dip sandwich which she could not finish.  The grandchildren had some good options from the children's menu, but opted for corn dogs and fries.  But their meal included both beverage and dessert.  Dessert was choice of chocolate or vanilla ice cream and they were very generous scoops.  They even had enough to share with us.  Service was great.  Adam 809 is one to ask for.  Kept us topped up with beverages and regularly checked in with us.  Nice guy, great server.  We four left happy.

Deviled egg app with a side of sugared bacon was delicious!  We crumbled the bacon & sprinkled it on the egg. Yum!  I had their signature chicken dish which was tasty but unevenly seasoned. It was blackened, which I liked, but one bite would be salty & the next very peppery. A side of creamed spinach was good but rather rich. Hubby had fresh fish which was fine (I thought it a little plain) and my daughter had blacked tuna which she loved. We enjoyed sitting outside. I wanted to stroll around in the surrounding shops afterward but was surprised they closed at 7pm.
The Lobster Bisque is possibly one of the best soups I have ever had in my life. It is not always on the menu, so when you see it, get it. It is crazy delicious.
Atmosphere was a lovely service was a bit slow food was perfect but the alcohol is flowing like mud.

Bricktops is a wonderful restaurant. Their food and service is consistently excellent. The have a warm and cozy ambience. This is s great place for family gatherings, first dates and girls nights out. The price points are very reasonable for the product you receive. Their menu provides a generous variety for the beef and potato lovers to the " I am counting my calories" diner. I have never had a bad dish at Bricktops  This is my go to place to eat when I want to relax, drink and have s great time with friends and family.

We went for dinner on a Thursday night. Very good food and service. Great crab cakes- fresh and not full of breading; it  actually consisted of real fresh crabmeat!  The ribs were delicious and falling off the bone. Full of flavor. Will definitely be back and recommend to others.
Went this past Sunday for my wife's birthday. Service was slacking. Meatloaf and mashed potatoes seemed canned. Not restaurant not what I was led to expect.
This was a delicious meal. It was also quite healthy with an ahi tuna salad and all for a reasonable price. Would recommend this to anyone for a quick lunch in the South Park area.

I have lived in Charlotte for 15 years and was shocked that I had never been here.  This is a very nice place for lunch.  I have been twice in a month and found the service to be warm and professional and the food to be excellent.  I'm sure the dinner menu is a bit different so I'm anxious to try it soon, too.  So far, they have some of the best fish and chips I've found.
Exceptional dining and service! We love this place.  You get treated like royalty.  The food is first rate. We come here all the time.  We are always impressed.

My burger was great. French fries were great also. Very nice spot. Outside patio has great views of the shopping store. However my mimosa was nasty! I will get wine next time. We had a party of 25 and service was fast

Kale and Quinoa salad refreshing. Nice clean bright environment. No waiting for Sunday brunch. Crabcakes were meaty but not too flavorful. The deviled eggs and bacon was a bit too sweet. Savory egg filling would've been a better contrast to the sweetened bacon. Overall, I might dip around the corner to O'Hop for about half the price. .

A A AWESOME!  i know this is a chain but I'm head over heals for the sugared bacon and deviled eggs...gluttony at it's best.  (Not one of my finer moments.)  Oh Oh..the chocolate chip cookie is baked in an iron skillet and brought to yor table that way.  Really, who does that?
The best BBQ chicken salad that I have ever had. Patio seating was very nice. Service was great. Loved the variety of items on the menu. Definitely recommend this hidden gem.

Service was great! Nice atmosphere. The blue cheese dressing was to die for! My friend was staring at my salad while I ate. Menu looked to be seasonal. The Chicken Milanese was juicy and crusted with Parmesan. The beurre blanc (sp) was nice and light. Would definitely go back again!

Fantastic Food and Service - Need to know who to ask for if you want great service (you know what that means!  Should I name the great ones?)  Prime Rib (Ordered "as RARE as Possible!!!  Served as rare as possible...  Every Time!!!) with raw Horseradish - PERFECT!!!  Not not look at my photos if you are _____ ish about Blood and Bones!  Bread - Being very smart Bricktop's gets there bread from Nova's Bakery!  Ribs - Almost every time I get Baby back Pork Ribs - Bricktop's makes them Perfectly!  BBQ Sauce for a simple sauce this one is very good!  Fries - One of My favorite places to get Fries!  BBQ Sauce - Excellent!!!  Dessert - Keylime Pie with a Thick Macadamia and I think Graham Cracker Crust - The BEST Keylime Pie I have ever eaten!!!  One of the Best Desserts in Charlotte!

This place is top notch is service and food quality!  No matter what I've eaten such as the classic chicken and waffles on lyft offered amon Sundays or the fall off the bone baby back ribs, the food is always hot, fresh and of high quality.   The service is unmatched. Anytime I've needed a special accommodation or if something was worn for with an order or mixed up, the problem is always corrected quickly and something is always taken off the bill or the.manager stops by to apologize. The really care about your experience here.   If you want to visit this place. Go on a Sunday around 2pm. This way you can enjoy thier awesome chicken and waffles and miss the church crowd that causes the waits.

This is a beautifully decorated spot. The waitstaff is professional and on que. the manager and chefs greeted and checked on patrons. We ordered Chilean sea bass which was prepared perfectly ...Asian flare with julianned fresh veggies. The wine selection is great. This is a place we will visit again!

Bricktop's is one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte. Their entrees are light and flavorful, and they have great wines. They have a great patio and heat lamps in the winter, so we frequent that area. The lunch crowd is always busy, and so is dinner - so you know it's good. We never have trouble getting a spot, and if so we will just sit at the bar. The staff is usually very attentive and nice. The flavors and pairings are all good for the specials and regular food. I believe sushi is a newer add, can't vouch for it, but literally never had a bad meal here. Tried fish, chicken, steak and crab/tuna salad which is my absolute favorite. I love that I'm always satisfied but not overstuffed after leaving. It's also very classy, but not fine dining expensive, so it's a good balance. Can't recommend you go here anymore than I have, you shouldn't be disappointed!

Rolled in with a party if 17 and Collin, jessica and Jason took such great care of us!! Excellent food, timely delivery! Drinks never went empty!! Highly recommend for a fun night with family or friends!!!

This was my first time at Bricktops, and let's just say I wasn't impressed given that I had high expectations from reading other reviews. From the moment I sat down, I didn't feel welcome. The food was mediocre at best, but it's their service that killed it for me.  Not once were we ever checked upon and asked how our food was nor were we offered a refill of our water.  If you're looking for pretentious waiters and managers who look down at their customers, I suppose this is the place for you.

I have pasted this restaurant see weak times shopping but I have never stopped. I wasn't sure exactly if it was a pizza restaurant or fine dining but my family finally decided to stop and eat here. We were not disappointed. We were able to get reservations for dinner the same day and did not have to wait long even though we showed up early. We started with the deviled eggs and bacon which I am not a egg fan but they were really good and the bacon was great ! I ordered the Bistro chicken with mash potatoes and spinach. The entree was delicious and the chicken was tender. The only complaint was it seemed to be a little salty for me. My parents had the sea bass and the meatloaf. They both enjoyed both entrees. I think this restaurant will be in our regular rotation !

That Hana Ranch Hawaiian Ribeye. Holy crap. I think that is probably the only thing I will ever get from here if I ever come back. Sure, this place is a little pricey, but that ribeye was well worth it.  Walking in, you get a sense of high class. But, if you're not worried about the atmosphere, then I wouldn't worry about it. I went in wearing jeans, and well I can say we stood out. But who cares?  I ordered the ribeye. It melts in your mouth with a little bit of tanginess, and at the same time sweet. It was quite an experience. The loaded stuff potatoes was a little over the top. I should have ordered the Mac n cheese, but sadly I didn't do that.   Another honorable note is that their croutons are absolutely amazing. They melt in your mouth just like the rib eye. I believe they hand make them as well.

Went here for the first time a couple of days ago.  Quickly seated and service was attentive even though they were very busy. Food was of good quality.  Pleasant decor. My wife said it is an older persons place but there was  a variety of clientele. I would like to go back here again.  Good flavor to the food.

Ate here for lunch.  Nice interior and service was very good.    Deviled eggs were good but had like a sweetness to them.  Which is weird because the millionaires bacon that comes with the eggs is very sweet and awesome!  The Ahi Tuna salad I had was only okay.  Fish was over cooked and the salad part was soggy.  Didn't have time to deal with sending it back.  I will go back if I'm in the area again but may steer clear of that particular menu item.
Nice restaurant ... Very upscale ... High dollar ... You need to dress well and make sure you are hungry ... Beautiful ambience and the waiters are awesome

Every aspect of this restaurant is top notch. The hostessss with their black dresses and pearl necklaces to the decor. The waitress recommended the new pork chop which was wonderful. Only caveat is the parking is tight spots. Location has not changed

Just got here, still very busy. Our booth still very wet from being cleaned, both seats and table.
