When hostess was informed, instead of just wiping it down she began to justify the condition by stating it was clean. Had to wait for drink orders. Not impressed with Svc thus far. Martini seemed to lack alcohol & it's $10. Had to wait fairly long for food. When it arrived it was hot and very tasty. Kudos for flavor except for sauteed spinach; garlic overload. My burger while very good was overdone. Our server who was very pleasant comped the burger when he discovered it was not as I ordered. He did so without me requesting it. I will go back, but service really needs to consider the customer more.

Impromptu lunch date with the fam!  Let's do it!  We actually went in blind not knowing what kind of food or anything but what a pleasant surprise! White table cloth and kinda fancy but not at all pretentious.  The service is excellent.  I wasn't super hungry so I opted for ahi salad which was perfectly delicious with mango and jicama. Yum!  The kids were impressed with their food (cheeseburger and grilled cheese) but apparently the fries were the best they'd ever had! My husband had the ahi burger which he enjoyed as well. Because l went light on lunch I indulged with dessert!  The bread pudding is DELICIOUS!!!  We will definitely be back for dinner soon.  I only took one star away because it is a bit pricey for what you get but the food is certainly good.
Always consistent, never disappointed. Loved the flat bread pizzas. Crabtini was excellent. Good service, good place for a business lunch.

Everything was delicious. Especially the fries. Hot and fresh. When there was an issue, our waitress, Rasheda took care of it. The breakfast casserole was great. Shrimp and grits good. Steak and eggs great. Chicken and waffles were on point. We will definitely be back.

Outstanding!   From the Artichoke for appetizer To the chocolate chip Sunday for dessert!   Everything was amazing!   Had:  Ribs, Kobe sirloin, mixed salad, kale and spinach sautéed.... All were magnificent   Wine- awesome poor! And amazing!   Highly recommend!

Wedge salad very good. I had the French dip. I asked for medium rare prime rib. This was not honored. It was still pretty good.   My friend had fish tacos. She didn't comment.   Beautiful surroundings.   Service cut a star off my rating. Our server was clueless to nuances.

Solid dinner.  Something for everyone, we always start with the sushi (one cali and one tuna) and end with the cookie (delish).  The kale/quinoa salad is actually delicious and i highly recommend it as a side,  flavorful & refreshing

I eat at Bricktop's quite often and LOVE it! Their chicken sandwich is delish not to mention the deviled eggs.  It is a very nice atmosphere, but still reasonably priced. The patio is also very nice to sit at when the weather is good. Would definitely recommend.

I almost hate giving out a big ol' 5 star review based on one visit, but I don't mind giving a low rating on one visit, so turnabout is fair play!  The fella and I took our first trip to BrickTop's on a Wednesday night; the main reason we went was because they were one of the few places NOT doing Restaurant Week.  We made an 8:00 pm reservation and were greeted and seated right away when we got there at 7:50.  The place was a little more fancy than we'd expected; it felt like a 131 Main or Vine to me with the dark wood, gauzy lighting fixtures overhead, and numerous booths.  We had a view of the bar from where we sat, and it looked pretty inviting and a little swanky.  Our waitress was prompt, engaging and friendly.  We started with the deviled egg & sugar bacon appetizer ($10), which was good, but not as great as I expected.  The sugar bacon was super chewy, but the eggs were good - almost sweet as opposed to vinegary like most deviled eggs.  I can't knock off points on the bacon though because... well, it's bacon.    For dinner, I got the Parmesan crusted chicken ($22) with lemon butter sauce and capers and a baked potato for my side, and the fella got the prime meatloaf (which was more like a large cone of delicious meat) and a side of the Cinderella whipped potatoes ($22).  The chicken was the best thing I've eaten in a loooong time with a buttery, delicious sauce, and then I tried the meatloaf.  Then THAT was the best thing I'd eaten.  The fella and I usually like to play "who got the best dish," and I'm pretty sure it was a tie at BrickTop's.  With an appetizer, bottle of wine, and two entrees, our total bill WAS a little pricey ($90ish + tip), but I don't mind paying to get a really good meal and service, and that's what we got.

Deviled Egg appetizer is to die for! Dover Sole fish entree is littered with bones -- beware!!!! Atmosphere is great -- nice, but not stuffy.  Service is hit and miss. We were there on New Year's Eve and our waitress seemed totally sidetracked although it was only 5:30.

Went there for dinner last night with my coworker. Crowded but got seated right away. Cool vibe, great server, outstanding food, scrumptious dessert!!   I ordered the Bistro Chicken -- pan sautéed, thinly sliced, served with creamy whipped potatoes & fresh sautéed spinach -- heaven on a plate. I ate every last crumb on my plate.   The dessert didn't disappoint - do desserts ever disappoint though? Vanilla ice cream with espresso and truffle almonds - I wanted another one.   My coworker order the filet with mashed potatoes and got a side of roasted corn.  Do yourself a favor and order that side. You won't be disappointed.  She ordered the chocolate chip cookie and she loved it!!  We definitely made the right decision and we definitely will go back when we are in  Charlotte!!!

We made a reservation at Brick Tops for Queen's Feast.  The table was ready for us when we arrived early, our dining partners were held up in traffic and were 15 minutes late.  Restaurant Week is a busy time for many of the nice places in Charlotte, but we were treated to the superior service and fabulous food we have enjoyed in the past, even though it was Restaurant Week and they were very busy.  We were not rushed at all, the food was perfectly cooked and we had a relaxing and enjoyable meal.  PLUS, we could hear each other speak at the table.  We could actually have a conversation!  This is so rare today with all the restaurants doing nothing to quiet the sound.  I would pick Brick Tops any time we want a nice meal out with friends.  Absolutely loved it and so did our friends who had never been there.  I will sing their praises to anyone who will listen!

Absolutely the best cuisine and ambiance in Charlotte.  Wait staff are highly trained and very professional.  The meals were prepared fresh, served hot, and the flavors were delicious.  Not as expensive as other restaurants.  Will definitely go back!!  Cannot wait :)

Best kids menu for only $6 with healthy choices like salmon and Mahi and grilled chicken with beautiful sides like broccoli and spinach and other veggies in addition to typical kids choices. The trout with crabmeat and Burre Blanc was fantastic and my husband really enjoyed his prime rib! The service was spectacular and David took fantastic care of us!

Food is always excellent. Price is a little high but you are paying for excellent service, great food and not being bothered. While we were there we sat next to a famous racecar driver, wife and little girl. No one stared or bothered them. Normal to see this in neighborhood. Deviled eggs are impeccable and I always order them. Sautéed spinach, salads, burger, fish tacos... Can't go wrong. All great. Love the artwork.  Dressy casual attire
I don't know, maybe it was just a lot fancier than we expected, but the food was mediocre and the service was poor.  We won't be back.

I've ate here a couple of time and always the food was wonderful.  I've had their salmon, chicken and steak and it's always been served to perfection --not to mention always tasting just great.  I've only ate here at lunch but the service has always been extremely efficient, and polite.   The restaurant is very clean and has a great overall atmosphere.  If I had to pick a lunch place to eat this would probably be one of them; the food is just always good.

First of all this place has amazing food. We come here all the time with our entire family. We eat big and spend big including the tips. Beautiful set up ad and decor. Waitstaff can go from awesome and excellent to obviously doesn't want to be here. The hostess are the real issue they run on a power trip. You're a hostess, not the front door to Studio54. They can be very rude and unaccommodating to babies. Please get better hostesses (all of them) and then we can move up the stars.

A complete satisfactory experience from beginning to end. The restaurant is very nice and the servers and staff are very friendly and professional.   The lunch menu offers a great selection and the prices are fair. The food was spectacular! I mean really good! My Red Snapper was perfectly cooked and the whipped potatoes are excellent. Their Chicken Milanese is also delicious. My only complain would be that I wish they'd give you bigger portion of potatoes.   The afternoon got even better when our dessert arrived. A delicious bread pudding covered in a vanilla run sauce. Wow wow wow!   We will definitely return and if they are consistently good this could be our "go-to" restaurant.

This place is the worst ever restaurant ever and I had a huge bug I'm my salad. The waiter didn't care at all and neither did the manager! The restrooms haven't been cleaned in months and there are cockroaches everywhere. I wouldn't take my worst enemy to this shit hole. Do yourself a favor and go Taco Bell!

Bricktops Restaurant is a casual eatery located across from the Southpark mall.  I have eaten lunch here on two occasions and both times my meal was pretty good.  My favorite menu items so far are definitely the amazing french fries and the delicious guacamole.  My issues with Bricktops really lie in the details.  First, do I really have to remind you to bring me a straw?   That drives me crazy.  Second, when I order a hamburger medium it should probably come with at least a tiny bit of pink on the inside - not charred all around.  I never send food back, but I was tempted this time!  I actually had to salt my burger - something I have never done before - because there was absolutely no flavor.  I ordered the bleu cheese burger and it came with bleu cheese on the top and caramelized onions on the bottom of the bun.  The onions were overpoweringly sweet and that did not help my poor charred burger taste any better.    However, on the up side... this place is very family friendly, and the entire staff is very nice.  It is the perfect place for a baby shower, a lunch with the girls or a business meeting.  We will definitely go back and hope for a better taste experience next time.

I am someone that is very particular when it comes to sushi, and I have to say, Bricktop has some of the best sushi I have had in Charlotte. So unique and fresh. The atmosphere is very classy yet inviting and the staff here is so friendly and recommends the best options on the menu that cater towards your foodie desires. This place is somewhere I have surprise birthday parties all the time, they are so helpful all the time!

I visited Bricktops today with my mom to enjoy a nice lunch while she was in town visiting from New York.  I have heard good things and wanted to check it out.  We arrived around 12:30, and did not have a reservation.    This is a very busy place and I'd suggest a reservation and would make one next time- even for lunch!  It was a busy spot.  We were greeted by the hostess who informed us that it would be about a 30 minute wait.  The hostess was a bit snooty- but maybe she was just being focused at her job.  She could definitely smile more!  We were seated in the bar area at a booth after waiting around 20 minutes.  We started with an appetizer of spinach and artichoke dip.  It came with chips that seemed house made.  It also came with salsa which was very flavorful.  It was good dip but nothing out of the norm.  Lunch was a cheddar burger for me, and a Cobb salad for mom.  The burger was enormous!  Even big enough for my husband who always complains about the size of burgers at restaurants.  It was $14.  The Cobb salad has awesome presentation and was $16.  Both are pictured.  We finished up our meal with the cookie skillet... Which is much recommended! It was delicious and came with a huge scoop of ice cream with Carmel sauce- but we had it on the side.  It was $7.  The service was so-so.  We did not get checked on a ton considering all of the food and courses we ordered.  The bartender was our server and she did have a full bar most of the time, but maybe they should have other servers besides the bartenders during this type of volume.  The food was good.... The people we interacted with were ehhhhh.  The food made me want to return but I wouldn't say the service did.

2/7/17 Another 5 stars for this great restaurant      My server was very very good and very attentive  Food and service excellent ! Disappointed that they no longer have daily specials they were a nice add to the regular menu Today daily specials were sushi not a fan of sushi  Happy that they always now have the steak and fries  Will gladly go back  as often as I am in South Park

This is a place that never disappoints. Great appetizers, tasty drinks, and amazing salads. The deviled eggs are legendary! I get them every time I go. The staff is attentive and the atmosphere is cool, casual, and stylish. I have a great time every visit.
The firecracker sushi rolls were delicious! I also ordered the Palm Beach Salad. Loved it. Service is good. Could improve.

I have been to Bricktops many times and have ordered many different dishes.  My favorite is their Veggie Burger!  Not expected at a place like this, but their Veggie Burger Rocks!  The chicken fingers are light and crispy. Their fries are thin strips of crunchy goodness! The ribs are tender and juicy. I could go on....  The only negative is their pour.  Perhaps because it was Wednesday Martini Special Night, but their pour was very weak.  Also, I asked for Cointreau and received triple sec - huge flavor difference to those who know.  Never the less, I still give Bricktop's a 4 star as their food is always good!

Not impressed at all! First there was a 20 minute wait to sit on the heated patio so we opted to sit at the bar. We started with spinach artichoke dip which was bland and boring for 10.00. The bartender was ok she dint ask if it was good or not and after two bites I decided not to waste my calories. Next I ordered the lobster roll figuring what was the special had to be good. My husband had a crab salad with shrimp and avocado. When my lobster roll arrived it was on a hamburger bun???? With sesame seeds? The lobster was ok blah completely not quality of 19.00 no one asked if it was ok.  I ate half and she took my plate. My husband salad had so much avocado and hardly any lettuce. I definitely will not waste 60.00 for lunch here again. What a bad choice!

WOW!  the SoPa Cougars were right!!  This place is fantastic!  Was here Saturday for brunch.  Had the devilled eggs (comes with weird sugary bacon....not for me) but the eggs also come with spicy chili sauce - to die for!!    I had the crab salad, pretty pricey (I think it was 14-16 bucks) but was worth every penny.  Peach bellinis....need I say more.  My friend got a filet and wedge special, also awesome.  All ingredients are super fresh and presentation was gorgeous.  There is also a beautiful patio I cant wait to visit this summer.  Great decor, cozy but classy touches (the chandeliers in the bar could double as grasshopper galaxies.  Love it!
Ahi Tuna was amazing!  Best I've ever had. Great place, my wife and I will certainly be back!

Two words for this place: Deviled Eggs.  This place is a zoo for lunch (haven't gone for dinner) with the south park business crowd. Nothing I've ever gotten here has been bad... the service is decent. I think the only beef I have with the restaurant is that they have dinner prices at lunch.

Brunch was good but the proportions were small for the amount of money. I left feeling like I spent a fortune and didn't feel it was worth what I spent.   Overall, the food is good and the donuts are to die for.   I think this is a place to experience once, but I don't know if I would go back for the price.

This is one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte.  There is nothing here that is not outstanding.   The food is amazing.  The service and atmosphere are also amazing.  Today, I met my friend Dan and we were seated in a cozy booth next to the bar.  It was a spot that I could have occupied for hours because it was just so comfortable.  In fact, we were there for a few hours!   I had the chicken dish with yummy mashed potatoes and sautéed spinach.   It was better than just five stars!   This was a refreshing lunch because it was full service, the food was served on real plates, and it was not a fast order at the counter experience.   We need MORE of these!   The price you pay may be a little bit more than the fast counter restaurants , but you really do get what you pay for!   Bricktop's has earned its reputation in Charlotte and If you haven't been here, you are missing out.   Three thumbs up!

Our party of two received the best service during lunch today from the front desk to Anthony, our server. I've eaten there several times and love the variety of selections on the menu. I had the veggie burger this time. It is huge and so very good and moist. The deviled eggs ARE the best! Great dining experience, even during the busy lunch! Nearly every table has guests, but there were always tables available for more. We will be back soon for the black bean and chicken chili!
Great place for consistent lunch and dinner meals.  Comfortable setting with efficient and attentive wait staff

It is pretty good, but a bit over rated and also slightly overpriced. The deviled eggs are talked up a lot. They are good, but they are deviled eegs. The only thing that makes them special is the Sugar Bacon.  I had lunch there and the tuna sandwich was good, but it was served with a run of the mill hamburger bun. Really ... You couldn't have done better than a lame bun?

This place was lovely and the food was very good. My shrimp and crabmeat salad was so good that I wish the dish would be a bit bigger.. yummy taste though. The service was very good and tables were nicely separated from each other. Loved the ladies room and the artwork there.

Great brunch! I love the smoked salmon app at brunch and the donut holes. Must try! And the carafe of champagne is delish! But don't get a mimosa unless you want lots of pulp in it. Also they have a really cool make your own bloody mary bar!

Been here a couple times and both times were lunch.  I just recently was turned onto the Palm Springs salad by my all knowing girlfriend and OMG, it was perfect...plain and simple.  I know I will end up burning that dish out because that's how I do but I don't care.  Nothing else on the menu can likely compare.  I do however enjoy their flat bread pizza but this salad is the perfect portion and calorie for me.  Great service and good food takes Bricktop's to The Top of my lunch place spots.

I was so looking forward to having lunch here!  The hostess and the wait staff were wonderful and very attentive.  A tiny salad and two small strips of tuna steak was $18.00 and not very good.  There are fabulous places in the exact same area that are much better for less money.

I love this place. They have the best sushi in Charlotte (hands down) it's always fresh! They don't have a huge selection but you can count on quality ingredients, try the Hollywood or California roll. Just Sit at the bar (If there is room), the bartenders are great and it's more fun! The patio is a nice option too. The dining room tends to be filled with an older snotty crowd, so I avoid it unless I'm with a group. If you like french fries order a side. They are skinny and so good! They have great salads appetizers and entrees. You can't go wrong at bricktops!

I was referred to Bricktops by a friend of mine who swore by their build-your-own Bloody Mary bar.  The brunch date me and Bryan went on here was somewhat of a disappointment in that area, as they stopped doing it the week before.  Also, remember if you go on a Sunday you cannot order am adult beverage until 12:00 pm..... We were at our table for an hour and a half!  Our poor server! I will say, I had the chicken and waffles and they were outrageously good! My first experience with that Southern goodness dish...... I was impressed with Bricktops but haven't made it back after my first visit.  I will say if you go, go early! It gets packed by the family-churchgoers :)

My new favorite place! The guacamole was amazing and so were the ribs, mashed potatoes, and creamed spinach. The deviled eggs were good but not my favorite. The candied bacon paired well with the eggs, a nice touch.

I am absolutely in LOVE with BrickTop's. I stumbled here on accident one day looking for  mozzarella sticks, which I found out they don't serve. But, they DO make THE BEST Prickly Pear Margarita I have ever had anywhere in the wold. It is DELICIOUS. The spinach and artichoke dip is fabulous. I always get steak tacos with insanely good fries. And of course you can not leave without eating a cookie-in-a-pan. The menu is limited, but everything on it is sooooo GOOD.   The place also has a nice, comfortable atmosphere and it is always clean. I DO think it is expensive, and my husband and I both do not like to spend money wastefully, but honestly, the food is soooo good it's worth the price.   I can't recommend this place enough. It is my favorite restaurant in Charlotte. I think I will head there now for a Prickly Pear Marg.... soooooo good....

Always exciting to try a new place. Service and staff were great, very polite. We had lunch. Had 2 appetizers, popcorn shrimp, chips with guacamole. Both were good, a little pricey but decent. I had the cheeseburger which was big and cooked the way I asked. Wife had the BBQ sandwich which she said was very good. I would eat here again but at the moment I'm not thinking about when can we go back. I wasn't "wowed". For the two of us the bill was $80 including tip. Pricey for a lunch of this calibre. Oh, had tea for the drinks

This is a very nice restaurant. The atmosphere is very relaxing to me. I ordered the Scottish salmon and butter beans. The fish was very fresh and filling. They offered great portion sizes. My waitress was very accommodating and patient. I enjoyed and will be back again. I am not sure of the wait times here normally, because I had a reservation.

Excellent service! I'm from out of town so this was my first time here.  Tried the deviled eggs and bacon appetizer and followed advice of the waiter to add the Melinda's hot sauce...it was perfect and a lot for one person...better to share with one or two others. Salad was fresh and ample as a starter. Entree was the meatloaf-good flavor but a bit overcooked for my taste (prefer meat cooked medium not well)...good portion but I couldn't finish it.  I ate too many eggs! Ha! Overall a great experience and I'll be back next time I'm in Charlotte.

I've always been a fan of Bricktops however this visit was problematic. Prices have really gone up since my last visit. One of the appeals for me was I felt dining there was a real value. Now, not as much.  I visited the bar so I could take out. I ordered roasted chicken  which is my favorite menu item. During this visit I asked for an extra helping of vegetables instead of the potatoes. The bartender told me they wouldn't sub a green vegetable for potatoes. She said potatoes were a garnish.... and she had to charge for 2nd vegetable. A garnish? Really? I left with the impression that she just didn't want to deal with my simple request.

Not often I give 5 stars!  Went once for a friend's 10-guest birthday dinner in June 2015 and my gf ordered the BEST crab cakes I've ever had. My grouper with crab meat was phenomenal as well. Great mashed potatoes.   Martinis were superb (not that I go to restaurants for the drinks).  Service was superb as staff did a great job keeping the drinks flowing and serving all food at once for 10 ppl on a Saturday night.   I can't wait to bring my family here for a visit!

Yum! It's a busy restaurant so it is recommended to make reservations if you can. I didn't have to wait for a table, but a few people who came after me did. Service was good... We had to wait a little too be served and eventually someone else took over from our original server, and he was much better and faster! We had fish with veggies, and steak with fries. Both meals were flavored well, and done well. Very tasty! Parking is nearby and convenient, but may be a bit of a hassle on a busy night. Otherwise there meal was great! Atmosphere is adult, but good for children to dine as well.

We had Japanese earlier in the evening, but I knew that I was going to be hungry again. We were staying across the street and the parking lot was full, so one of these restaurants has to be the draw. We sat at the bar and the bartender was awesome! She even heard me when I told my partner that the drink was too sweet and offered to fix it. I ordered the chicken strips as I didn't want a full dinner. That and I thought everything was a bit pricy. not for the quality of food that is presented to you! The strips were juicy, plump and crispy. But not greasy. And there were 8 huge pieces. the shoestring fries were golden and cooked to perfection. Now the slaw was in a world of it's own. Thinking that this is the best I have ever had. Creamy but not to spicy and crunchy. Yum, yum! Of course when I saw the huge slice of key lime pie my friend had. I had to get my own. (There will be no touching the dogs bowl in this group) The atmosphere was delightful, as well as the service. Great find!

Not the same Bricktops from yesteryear. Tavern burger was floating in grease and extremely over seasoned. Cob salad was good but something in it caused cotton mouth. Drinks were good! Waiter could be best described as pleasantly reluctant to provide top notch service. Probably will not try again for a while.

This place is great!! My favs are ahi Tuna salad, Cobb  salad, yummy salmon, ribs & beef carpaccio (when available). On Sundays the homemade donuts are a total hit. My fav servers are James & Boggy!!!

My boss took me here today for lunch. I'm definitely coming back with my husband. The ambience and service were excellent. OMG! The deviled eggs and bacon!!! Delish!! I ordered the Palm Beach salad. It was huge! Lump crab meat, shrimp, avocado...all of my favorites. My boss ordered the skillet cookie with a scoop of vanilla ice cream- heaven! Definitely returning!

Bricktops is what I would call upscale affordable.  Service and food quality is very good from reviews I read, but for me only one of two hit the mark for my visit.  It was a Saturday night and insteading of waiting for a table my friend and I decided to eat at the bar.  She had a cheeseburger and I had a ahi tuna salad and a few beers.  Food quality was great, but the service, which was good in the beginning, fell way behind after or initial order.    The bartender got our initial order....by the way I was the only one drinking alcohol...a draft beer, so one could see my glass was empty from a distance............unfortunately the bartenders passed by over and over and over never asking if I wanted a refill.  I eventually got another beer, but by that time dinner was just about completely eaten.  Its a beer folks.....only service can screw that up....and bricktops did just that...at these prices I'll look for other locations close by to give my money to in the future.

Awesome, love the brunch. Fresh ingredients made with skill, great waffles, and eggs benefict! Not to mention there dinners set the same standard. My one complaint is there ahi tuna sandwich is a bit to salty.

We went to Bricktop's for lunch and had reservations. We arrived a few minutes late, but we were immediately seated and everyone was very friendly, courteous and quick to accommodate our lunch party.   Service - Definitely 5 stars! The waiters that attended to our table made sure we always had water filled, drinks being served and were very attentive to notice when someone was finishing up with their plate so it was quickly removed from the table. There was no pressure to order appetizers, dessert or anything if we didn't ask about it or want it.  Food - A solid 5! We had the deviled eggs/bacon, the shrimp and the guacamole/chips for our appetizers. All were served very fresh, full of flavor and the portions were perfect for appetizers. For our entrees I had the meatloaf with twice baked potato, another person had the fish tacos with spinach and another had the salmon with creme spinach. All three entrees were definitely a hardy sized portion, our food was delivered in a timely manner and all were cooked properly and full of flavor.  Parking - ZERO! Bricktop's is located across the street from SouthPark mall and in a shopping center beside William's & Sonoma where there was absolutely not enough spaces to accommodate the patrons, no valet service available, small parking spots and a very frustrating experience. Going in for the meal we were frustrated from having to search, wait and then park. Leaving we were frustrated as we tried to rush out of our place so the next person could park, get around cars sitting and waiting for customers in other stores and then simply an overall poor design of the parking lot.  Overall, Bricktop's definitely warrants a solid 4! I will return for the exceptional service, well prepared and great appetizers and entrees, but I will make sure I allow enough time to park over at the mall and then walk over to the restaurant.

My friend suggested this as a place to take clients and it exceeded my expectations. The Ahi Tuna burger is fantastic! I've taken a few clients and they've had nothing but glowing reviews. Bricktops is now my go to place!

I am a fan of the menu of this restaurant. The food deserves four stars but the service is 3 stars based on my two experiences there.   My husband and I really enjoy the food. We like the Deviled Eggs and the Millionaire Bacon, the meatloaf, Chicken Milanese and the ribs.   We've had a mixed experience with the service. The first time we sat at a booth in the bar area and had FANTASTIC service. That server really set the bar high for subsequent servers. The second time we dined we ate in the dining room and  the service was adequate but not great. There was a couple sitting across from us and apparently the whole entire staff knew the woman of the couple and congregated at their table during our entire dinner which was  distracting because they were laughing and talking as if they were at a party.  With the restaurant practically full, I wondered how they had so much time to congregate. Did they not have other customers to attend to?  Our waitress was adequate but really busy and when  she came to our area, she spent a lot time chit chatting with the couple instead of checking on us at regular intervals.  She had various helpers bring items but  after our flatware was removed with our appetizer dishes, we had to request new  utensils. We had a hard time flagging our her down when we needed something, she  just always seemed in hurry. We had to request drink refills, they were not offered. We had to request bread, it was not offered. We felt like she was not attentive,  like  we were an afterthought, not really a priority. Also the timing was off on a couple of courses. My husband got his salad long after the appetizer but about two seconds before his entree.    Since the second visit was for my husband's birthday, I was somewhat disappointed that service was not as good as the first time. This experience did color my perception of the restaurant somewhat. I left my normal tip since service was not horrendous, but I was not thrilled with it either. Since we had a good initial experience,  I am willing to  attribute this to just a fluke.  I would come here again because of the menu. But if we experienced lackluster service again, I would be not be inclined to return.  Servers need to understand that good service adds to the quality of the experience. It is not just about the food. If I just wanted good food, I would do take out or cook at home. I want the the opportunity to relax, have good meal and be properly attended.  UPDATE: I did notify the management of this restaurant about the second visit. The manager acknowledged that he had had to speak to the servers about congregating at  the couple's table to chat before. Apparently, they are frequent diners at the restaurant and a lot of the staff know them. He apologized and sent a gift card to be used at a future visit. We had already decided that we wanted to return there at some point in the future- they have a brunch menu that looks good- so this was a nice gesture. But if we get seated near that couple again, I am going to ask for another table. :-)

We were in town on business, staying nearby. Checked out this place at the beginning of the week and loved it! We had a great waitress and the food came out very fast. Food was delicious. Chicken dishes and steak were done perfectly. We returned later in the week. Service not as great the second day. Food was delicious though! Great lobster bisque and sushi.

First thing you notice walking through the doors is the noise level.  It was very busy on a Saturday night but nonetheless after a long tiresome day, this wasn't my cup of tea.  We even had to ask the waitress to repeat herself several times because we couldn't hear her over the noise.  I am getting older but I don't need a hearing aid yet.  Ordered guacamole appetizer and with first bite a warning signal went off.  There was no taste to the guacamole.  Only a slight taste to the salsa.  The chips were greasy and so we ate very little of a $9 appetizer.  No need to consume considerable fat grams on something with no taste.  My wife ordered chicken.  I ordered salmon.  Just like the appetizer, neither had any taste.  The mushrooms came in a separate bowl swimming in grease and cooked in wine.  The wine taste overpowered the mushrooms unfortunately.  Cost $56 to eat a tasteless meal.  I could have put that money in a jar to save for my hearing aid.  The only positive thing I can say about this restaurant is the service was quite good despite them being very busy.  It is conveniently located across from South Park Mall.  We were so unfulfilled that on the way home we stopped at Cook-Out and got a chargrilled chicken sandwich that had much more flavor than what we ordered here.

Bricktop's may not seem like anything unique when looking at the menu or location but don't be fooled. This restaurant, while it is large, has the wonderful service level of a small restaurant. The entrees they offer are 100% of the time well prepared and the kitchen is always willing to meet special accommodations. Some of my favorites include the crab cake and prime rib

On the way between Sarasota and Cape Cod.  Found BrickTops on Yelp. Really great place with exceptional service. Wife had the prime rib and i had the ahi tuna burger. Food was excellent.  Somewhat  similar to a Houstons. Will stop again next time near Charlotte.  Owners: Need to build one in Sarasota

Went the other night with a friend that raved about how good this place was.  The import beer selection was very small.  The beef Carpaccio was just average.  (if you want the best go to Collectors Cafe in Myrtle Beach, you'll be licking the plate). Then I got the Ahi Tuna which was missing something.  I"m not sure if it was the sauce that was throwing it off or what.  The scoop of white rice didnt even look appetizing

Been back again since my fairly recent review. Took my husband this time. I have four words for you: Get the deviled eggs.  I also got the veggie burger again. It was just as good. But seriously folks, the deviled eggs with bacon crumbles on top may be the best eggs I've ever had.

Love this place, especially on Sundays. Their Brunch is AMAZING!!!! The chicken and waffles for me is the best item on the menu, it's hard for me to order anything else because if I do, I feel as if I am missing out on something. I was not a fan of their grits or the mimosas, BUT the peach drink (can't think of the name) makes up for it. :) This is a perfect place for a girls brunch (which we did) or date night.

This has become our family go to.  They do a fabulous trout, love the crab cakes and the fries are the best in the city- thin and crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.  They even grind their own meat for the burgers.   The kids menu offers salmon instead of only offering unhealthy stuff like chicken nuggets and hot dogs. When I come with friends we sit at the bar and enjoy excellent cocktails and with the kids we sit outside and play games with our kids.   They can run around in the courtyard while we have a cocktail.  Its a little disappointing that we are there constantly and no one has ever recognized us, I like it when restaurants recognize and welcome their regulars.  But for the most part its a great cozy favorite for our family!

Bricktops is one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte! My boyfriend and I go all the time. The atmosphere is great. The staff is always pleasant and extremely helpful. We always look for Rob when we go. He is friendly and knowledgable. He knows his guests and always offers the best recommendations.   I wish I could tell you what to order specifically, but everything is absolutely amazing!! I will share some of my favorites with you.  Appetizers: the deviled eggs and millionaires bacon!! The bacon is thick cut and carmelized with amazing goodness. The smoked salmon is fantastic! I was shocked that it was served warm but this is my current favorite.   Meal: Parmesan Crusted Chicken is my all time favorite dish. The chicken is lightly pan fried with a fantastic lemon butter sauce and capers!!! Bistro chicken is blackened with the same sauce! This is a new favorite. Baby Back Ribs are fall off the bone. I can't share their secret, but they put some extra TLC into these.   Sides: Macaroni & Cheese! I have to have his every single time! Kale & Quinoa Salad is light and delicious. It's served cold which is very refreshing.   Last but not least, you have to order the skillet cookie!
I LOVE this place and have for years! It is my go to place for martinis always along with amazing food! Go see Troy, he is the bartender that can take care of of you!

This place has potential in being good. The flavors were there in the food, but everything I had was a little too salty for my taste. These were the list of food that I had:  Appetizer:  Spinach & Artichoke Dip Guacamole & Salsa Dip  Course: Jumbo Lump Crab Cake  Ahi Tuna Steak

This is my work group's favorite company sponsored meal location and on each occasion we've had good experiences with absolutely delicious food!   If you decide to go for lunch they serve several types of stacked salads which are a fun twist on an otherwise simple meal. Regardless of the meal I am there for I enjoy the variety of fish dishes they offer and light vegetable sides. The burre blanc sauce they offer is a great addition to the perfectly cooked fish dishes.   The raspberry martini is a great decision if you are adding a cocktail. It has a perfect balance of sweet to cut the liberal pour of vodka.   Sometimes the service is a bit slow but that's understandable considering how busy they get!

Friends rave about this establishment; we decided on a lark to go for a late lunch last week and wish we'd diverted to other eateries.   For starters, the wait staff was perhaps the most singularly unwelcoming crowd we have experienced in the city. Considering the upscale ambiance and the number of servers on hand versus the number of customers, waiting five or more minutes for someone to greet us and take a drink order is a little much. Furthermore, both of us also had, more than once, empty drink glasses for more than a few minutes during our meal. See previous comment.  We were situated near the kitchen, so I got the delightful view of our server chatting with another server while holding our drinks a few feet away from us. Our presence seemed at best to be an afterthought.   The food was acceptable but nothing exceptional; I have had far tastier meals for less money and better service at nearby Rooster's. The lobster in my lobster roll was bland, lacking the rich goodness that should make that sandwich so tasty, and the cole slaw was fundamentally sliced cabbage with mayo with a little sugar thrown in for good measure. Even the locally produced ice cream was scarcely discernible as peanut butter pie, its purported flavor.  My husband's french fries were good. That much we can say.  Overall, the restaurant reminded us of country club dining: overpriced mainstream and bland offerings amidst a homogeneous clientele. It was the Wonder Bread of upscale Charlotte dining, and in my many years of Charlotte living I can promise you better choices are literally down the block from Bricktop's.

Went here for our family Saturday brunch. We arrived at 11:30 and luckily we didn't have to wait too long before we got a table. It got so busy after 12pm. Our food was excellent. I recommend cob salad or crab salad. It was so fresh and healthy. I didn't feel guilty despite I was stuffed in the end.

So my parents were in town this weekend and I now realize where my indecisive nature comes from as we debated FOREVER about where to go on fathers day. It had to be close to my grandmothers ....dad wanted a big portion (as I prefer small plates so we did a lot of that for the majority of the weekend) ...and mom is super picky in the food department.  We finally decided on South Park and after circling for quite some time we let my dad make the executive decision. My dad walked into our first stop (Bricktops) and noticed the cranking AC and Prime rib and decided this would be our eating destination.   I had a salad and the pr special and felt both were pretty delicious considering how hungry I was. The twice baked potato had enough salt, butter, and cheese to qualify it as heart-attack inducing but tasty none-the-less! We spoiled ourselves and had dessert, I really enjoyed the chocolate chip cookie sundae thing and the key lime pie garnered rave reviews from the rest of the table.   Service was really great, I must say. Our server was on top of everything and made great recommendations. Considering how busy it was I was impressed.   Clean, beautiful, bright food ...it is not. Stuff your face on fathers day ...it is. I'm not sure id go back on my own but I wouldn't be against having another one of those twiced baked potatoes (following a long gym session!)

We normally enjoy the food and atmosphere, but this time we left feeling taken for granted. The server was new and well understood. But she dropped the food tray on our table and did got on my 9 year old. Barely a half hearted apology. Cmon
Top level service!! The devil eyes and bacon is awesome!! Always a great go to spot!  They know how to treat the customer.

Ever had one of those events when you had built it up so far in your mind that the reality couldn't possibly live up to the expectation?  Bricktop's is undoubtedly a victim of just such a happening.  Nonetheless, I think that even if I didn't have all this pent-up excitement of a warm chocolate chip cookie dessert in my mind, I would have still been disappointed.  Now I'm not normally one to hang out in the SouthPark area.  But I do understand that it's different than many other parts of town.  You go into this place and you can tell right away that it's like walking into a different planet.  From the outside you expect something like an Applebee's.  Inside, it's way more upscale.  That's not bad, but Bricktop's?  It just doesn't fit.  The name is way more casual than the interior suggests.  Bricktop's suggests downtown pizza joint, not uptown bistro.  Regardless, you are finally inside, and you're greeted with gorgeous wood and beautiful lighting.  It's really a nice looking place.  The menu, while not very impressive looking, has some nice dishes, with prices to match.  This is not casual dining.  Even for SouthPark.  Service is friendly, but not particularly good.  You are seated quickly, but then left on your own for way too long.  Food is brought out quickly - even more quickly than I would have expected, in fact - but you aren't ever checked on again.  Glasses remain empty.  Then again, maybe I'm just not the typical customer and they want me to leave.  As to food?  Definitely doesn't match the decor.  I don't have a problem dropping the amount of money they ask for their food, but I'd like to have something worthwhile in return.  Their burgers were monumentally disappointing.  Almost no flavor.  The blue cheese burger promised caramelized onions.  I didn't get onions of any kind, caramelized or not.  They would have helped.  The macaroni and cheese, made interesting with penne instead of macaroni, had a bizarre cheese sauce, more appropriate to a kids menu (which they have, but not appropriate here on a $5 side).  And the cookie?  Thin and crispy and generally unappetizing.  Even the ice cream that came with it didn't have much going for it.  There was a chocolaty (caramely?) sauce drizzled on top, but it could have used more.  I would, however, suggest ordering it when your food arrives, so that it gets there about as you are done eating.  Otherwise they will take your order with your plates and you'll be waiting for a while to get the cookie delivered.

Bricktop's topped our list of places to eat on this trip to Charlotte. We came on a suggestion from Yelp, but our  expectations were surpassed by the food and more importantly, the service. Rasheda is everything you want in a server. Period. She took such good care of us, and made us feel valued. Her recommendations were so on point and any requests that we made were fulfilled almost immediately. The prime meatloaf, the steak, and the Chilean sea bass were excellent, and the show stopper may have been the creamed spinach.'The serve staff worked as a team to meet the needs of us dining there. The manager was pleasant and friendly, engaging in conversation with us and actually allowed us to brag on our server without once trying to take any credit. Couldn't recommend Bricktop's enough!

Very nice spot for both lunch and dinner. Nice atmosphere where one can dress either casual or dressy and feel like they fit in. The staff is great and we've always had good service. Rarely do we have a wait when we go, even on a weekend evening or Sunday brunch. Definitely recommend!

Ate dinner here tonight. The wait was minimal for a Saturday night and the hostess kept us updated on our seating. Once seated or server came almost immediately. She was very attentive and helpful with menu questions. We had two apps, tempura shrimp and firecracker sushi roll. Wifey got fish tacos and I had the ribs. Both dishes were excellent! We sat outside which is set up very nicely. The menu prices are not cheap but the food is very good. Will definitely go back. Oh......the fries that come with the Ribs OMG!! AAA+.

Bricktops was wonderful I had the crusted parm chicken w/ spinach an the flatbread app with a bowl of lobster bisque.  The lobster bisque was as wonderful as when i was paula deans lady n sons :)  There was not just tiny pieces of lobster there were big pieces.  The flatbread very light, not heavy so to spoil you for your entree.  the crusted chicken w/ tomatotes and capers wonderful.  My freind had the ribs, they fell right off the bone, i tried one they melted in your mouth.  For desert the hot fudge sundae very light just enough to get that sweet for the ending of your meal.  I will be back to bricktops , service was great an staff was so friendly :)
Seriously, the deviled eggs with bacon crumbles on top may be the best I've ever had. The restaurant is in South Park, which is a really nice area of Charlotte.

Ate at Bricktop's for a business dinner today and got to try a plethora of different things; overall I was a fan of the food but not super blown away. -BBQ Chicken flatbread: this was decent; the chicken was juicy and the barbecue sauce added good flavor but the flatbread wasn't that crispy and flopped under the toppings -Tempura shrimp: very crispy on the outside but the shrimp were still juicy. The sauce was similar to bang bang shrimp from Bonefish/ Cheesecake Factory and was very tasty -Spinach dip: came with tortilla chips and salsa; all pretty standard- not bad but just average -Millionaire's bacon: great!! Pretty sweet but the saltiness of the bacon still came through, everyone LOVED this at my table. -Simple greens salad: exactly what you would expect; good portion for a salad but WAY too much dressing for my taste (I asked for it on the side but received it poured all over the top) -Crab Cakes: highlight of my meal! The lump crab was awesome and didn't need a lot of spice/sauce because it was so good on its own. The coleslaw it came with was average and the portion was fairly small but the taste was on point. -Chocolate chip cookie skillet: topped with ice cream and a good end to the meal. It wasn't extraordinary but it was a warm baked chocolate chip cookie topped with ice cream...you can't make it taste too bad -Key lime pie: everyone at my table thought this was WAY too tart and I agree. The graham crust was good but if you don't love key lime pie I would avoid for sure.   Our server was okay and the food took quite awhile to come out for each course, so I wouldn't advise eating here if you're in any sort of time crunch. Definitely a better place to relax and enjoy conversation without having to worry about being rushed out which is nice.

It's time for a Bricktop's update - and yes, while the stars are still the same I just had to offer some info about their brunch. Because...it.is.delicious.   Yes, a friend of mine sang a pretty song about Bricktop's brunch and within days hubs and I flew over to this SouthPark staple for some goodness. Their brunchy menu is in similar style to their lunch and dinner menu - new American eclectic. Not only do they offer a make your own bloody mary bar, but they also host a variety of specialty drinks (think blood orange mimosas and bellinis by the carafe - NOM).   I've eaten the same tasty dish both brunch visits - the French Toast. Big toasty brioche slices with sides of caramelized bananas, warm maple syrup, fresh whipped cream and crispy bacon. It's delicious not at all nutritious and heavy on the portion for $11. Also, if you're feeling quite indulgent check out the bite size homemade doughnut starter - 13 sugar doughnuts with three dipping sauces (raspberry, chocolate and vanilla cream).   The brunch bill can get a bit out of hand here, especially when you start drinking your weight in mimosas, but it's worth it. Check it out!
One of my Charlotte favorites. I eat there all the time and it is always perfect. Their palm beach salad is wonderful and a meal by itself. The ribs are quite simply the best in town.

Tried Bricktop's for the first time for brunch with an out of town friend. It was her suggestion. We were seated outside on the patio. The complimentary bread was tasty as we waited for the main dishes. I ordered the Steak Benedict. They ordered the Shrimp and Grits and the Palm salad. In my opinion the steak Benedict had an odd taste. The roasted potatoes we ok. I had a taste of the shrimp and they were well seasoned. The highlight of the meal was watching the servers try to bring down a rain guard as it began to pour down outside.  The leftovers of my meal will be thrown out as no one at my home even wanted to give them a try. I probably will not be back unless it's by a friend's suggestion.

This is one of my local favorites. I am pretty hard to please and 9 out of 10 times they do a great job. I went there for breakfast and they did not have sugar free syrup. The manager ask if I could wait and he would send someone to Harris Teeter after it. I said yes and he did it. I think they should keep it on hand but he sure impressed me with his desire to serve. Great place.

Tried this place out for brunch this past weekend with the parentals. Very warmly greeted when first entered and given a table immediately (we had reservations but you never know how those will go HAHA). Anyway, our server was very nice. They were pretty busy as it was a Sunday morning and we had a bit of a delay with the food. We tried the guac and salsa appetizer and it was really good. I had a blueberry waffle with fruit but the waffle comes warm and had a lot of butter on it which I tried to remove (I didn't want it too soggy) but it still got the middle of the waffle pretty soggy. It also didn't come with syrup so I had to ask for that separate but that was no big deal. My sister got one of the salads but mentioned that it was soggier than usual (with dressing) and she thought it was only so-so. We tried the doughnuts for dessert and they were covered in sugar so super sweet. Good idea though, who doesn't love dipping food in chocolate?!

I just want to reiterate how out of this world delicious the Tollhouse Cookie dessert is.  So good that my boyfriend and I must always ask for a knife to cut it down the middle as to avoid any debate on who stole the last bite!  Tears could get involved people...

I came to BrickTops for my birthday with 4 other friends. We started off with the deviled eggs and millionaire bacon, they were delicious! Also had the lobster bisque and that was really yummy! For the entree, I ordered the crab cakes and substituted the cole slaw for a loaded baked potato. The crab cake had good flavor, but the portion was extremely small for $30 and the baked potato came out cold. One of my friends ordered the prime meatloaf which was divine!!!! The meatloaf was delicious! However it was a very small portion, it was more like a meatball instead of a loaf. She also ordered a side of mashed potatoes that tasted like instant potatoes; which wasn't that great, she also added a side of mac & cheese which was pretty good.  Another friend ordered fish tacos with a side of fries. The tacos were actually pretty good. Had nice flavor to them, similar to a blackened taste.  My third friend ordered the chicken Milanese; the chicken was crispy and tasted like perfection. However the dish was supposed to come with a side of Alfredo but the kitchen "ran out", instead of telling us that there wasn't any pasta, they just neglected to tell us and sent the dish out without it. Boo!  The last dish ordered was the bacon cheeseburger with fries . It looked really good but I didn't get a chance to taste it. Overall the food was pretty good but I would not go back because it wasn't worth the price.

Visited here twice.  Great service both times.  They have some really exceptional entrees. The side dishes were not as stellar but still good. Listen and Listen well..... the BREAD PUDDING is exceptional( the desire to eat it sparked my second visit).  Great alcholic drinks-pricey but strong!

You can't go wrong here! It's buzzing every night with families date nights & girls group get togethers!! Menu is 1 page (true example of do less amazingly)   Most popular not to be missed appetizer is eggs & bacon.  Perfect for 2 people to share.  Great twist on a traditional favorite.  They have my favorite salad dressing called green goddess but this didn't come out of a squeeze bottle.   I have had many items on the menu that does change from time to time.  Don't hesitate on the Pork Chop the flavor is superb & it's a great portion.  The half chicken is a little crispy outside but juicy on the inside.  If you like fish then order the grouper it'll make you an instant fan! My favorite go to is baby back ribs.  Fall off the bone with a tangy sweet sauce that is finger licking good! Don't worry hot towel is on it's way! They have shoestring fries that compliment every dish & the loaded baked potato is a generous size & heaping in "loaded".  Lol we never have room for dessert. Lol in the warmer days get there early to sit out on the patio.  Make a night out of it! ENJOY!

I love sitting at the bar. Drinks and service are awesome. The NY Strip and twice baked potato are to DIE for. Ribs are delicious as well. My husband and I will definitely be going back again and again

Came here after work for a quick bite to eat at the bar with a buddy.  3 things stood out - none of them good.  1.  Don't be different in serving gin & tonic.  Served gin & tonic is a regular water glass, which was taller and narrower than what I'm used to drinking G&T out of--also regular straw dropped right in.  Looked like a sprite with a lime, if you ask me.  2.  Time the food service appropriately.  Enjoying the blue wedge salad for appetizer and didn't really get a chance to finish it because the main course arrived 6 minutes later... they had no awareness or were trying to rush us out of there.  Really disappointing that they tried to actively usher people out of there--more so when we're sitting at the bar.    3.  TUNA AHI BURGER SHOULD NOT BE MADE TUNA SCRAPS.  What a terrible, terrible menu item.  It was not a clean steak of tuna meat, rather, it was a TUNA PATTY.  I can appreciate that it was seared and raw, ONLY IF IT WAS TUNA STEAK.  How are you gonna use the leftover tuna scraps, make it into a patty, and only sear it?  It's very awkward item to eat overall--I'm pretty sure anyone that's had the tuna ahi burger here will not be getting it again.  It's more of a trap, in my opinion, where guests that order it "fell for the trick".    I will not be returning here.  If you are planning on going, then: (1) prepare to eat quickly; and (2) don't order the tuna ahi burger.    dmo out.
I really enjoy coming to this place.  I have been for brunch and dinner.  Service was always good and quick.  The food never disappoints.  I look forward to coming back again very soon.

I've always been a fan of Bricktop's and their food... It wasn't until this past Sunday that I went there for brunch. It was fantastic! The handmade mini donuts were insanely good and the waffle was delicious. Everything seems so fresh here. It's a little pricey but if you're willing to treat yourself definitely check out Bricktop's... Brunch or dinner you can't go wrong!

The service at Bricktops is great. A friend had her birthday brunch here. I ordered the chicken and waffles. Friends had their lobster bisque, that stood out with decent amounts of visible lobster pieces. As for the chicken and waffles, I thought that it was okay. My request for strawberries and whipped cream was met without issue. The waiter was also understanding when we wanted to taste each other's meals and provided spoons for sharing desserts.

This restaurant is located in the Southpark area and certainly upholds the upscale atmosphere that one would expect. Reservations are not required, but highly recommended if you want a table in a timely manner.  The hostess said that they only reserve part of the restaurant, but based on how busy they were on a Wednesday night, I can imagine that wait times could get lengthy on the weekends.  I ordered a wine on the menu and was disappointed to discover that they did not have this wine, nor had they had it for the past 2 months. There wasn't a comparable substitute so I was left with the option of ordering a different (less preferred wine) or going without- gasp.  Of course, I went with the substitute as this was my first baby-free meal in a month.  I ordered the American Kobe Steak and it was amazing; my husband had the Scottish Salmon and he was also very impressed. Everything was well cooked and came out very fast given how busy the restaurant was. Very nice to be at a restaurant that has it together time wise. The chocolate chip cookie, comes out in a cast iron skillet and is to die for.  Seriously a must have and worth every calorie!  This is definitely an upscale restaurant- all of the staff were in all black, with pearls and red lipstick.  Everyone was very professional but slightly cold.  There was not a lot of personality nor did anyone really engage with us, heck, I would have been thrilled with a smile after the initial greeting.  Overall, the food made up for what the staff is lacking in personality.  We will definitely be back.

Awesome Brunch spot in Charlotte!  Amazing chicken & waffles, and their quinoa & kale salad is delish!  The chicken was so tender and fried perfectly.  The grits were even great and I don't like grits usually.  AND...the Bloody Mary bar at brunch was exceptional!  Definitely a great place for a date or to bring a good of friends/family.  They have great superb as well!
Get the Deviled eggs and the bacon that's on it is to die for!  The service was good, place Is cozy. I'll go back there for the deviled eggs. That is all.

Truthfully, I wasn't impressed.  I had the Scottish Salmon which wasn't a salmon steak as I had expected.  Instead it was served as over cooked, pressed down salmon brick.  Seriously, it was as if someone had pre-cooked salmon, flaked it and then pressed/formed it into a rectangular patty.  Tasteless and dry.  The Deviled Eggs and Millionaires Bacon was pretty good.

Nestled in the great area of Southpark in a small strip of stores near the mall lies Bricktops. This was actually my second visit, but its been probably almost a year since my first.  The atmosphere is great, and the staff always seem to be on top of things. The menu is a tad bit pricey but the food always seems to be worth it.  I had the Parmesan Crusted Chicken which came with rice, and included a side of vegetables, and I got the Cauliflower (which I highly recommend).  Very yummy!!!  Definitely recommend this place for a nice dinner for two or even with a group of friends!!!
Absolutely positively fantastic. I had the crabcakes with the fettuccine, I couldn't be happier. I am a tough critic and this place was excellent.    I look forward to my next visit, spectacular

I absolutely love this place. It's our date night go to, even though I pig out on ribs the make sure to give you a hot towel to clean yourself up. Their lobster bisque is amazingly flavorful. My boyfriend loves there Caesar salad to start and is always switching it up and is never disappointed. And to finish we can't resist that warm delicious cookie

Ugh. This is why I don't eat at American restaurants much. The dinner menu (including a separate sushi menu for that matter) offered one meaningful vegetarian choice, a goat cheese flatbread. It was decent, but hardly special, and by no means worth the $15 price. I suppose a lot of restaurants like this exist, and I only go to them when I get pulled in by a group that doesn't share my diet. Nonetheless, I could reasonably hope for better options.  Certainly, the low-light ambiance and the crowded strip-mall parking didn't enhance my opinion of the place either.

I had high, rooftop hopes for Bricktops but these hopes were flushed away down a porcelain downspout like the meal I had five hours earlier.  Atmosphere - A modern designed room that has maple tables w/ cloth chairs, booths w/ red brick colored leather (or pleather) seats and copper accents throughout.  Service - Service was excellent.  The restaurant was slow and our original server was switched to a new one w/out explanation.  This was kind of odd but we did not ask why as the new server was cheery, helpful and refilled my tea numerous times.   Food - It was early dinner time so I was not looking for a big heavy meal and based on a suggestion from the server I had...da, da, daaaa,...the prime rib sandwich!!  This sandwich seemed like a great decision at the time but later took me to foreclosure and back.  The condemned medium rare misaligned roof meat was stacked high on a fine crusty, buttered and toasted sandwich roll which I dipped its' shingles into a French Onion soup tasting repossession au jus.  For dessert I had the "Chocolate Chip", which was a warm cookie in a skillet w/ vanilla ice-cream.  I determined it was either the meat on the sandwich or the sauce that got me sick as the dessert was shared w/my date and she did not suffer the same torture I went through around 10 PM that night.    Overall - The place left me feeling like a fool because about 4-5 hours later it left me feeling like I had a putty knife in my stomach...and this roof was ready to fall.  Once I evicted what was present I immediately felt relieved.  How do I know this is what got me ill?  Well the last time I ate that day was at 9 AM and it was cereal.  Additionally, I felt immediately better after serving notice on this money pit and then selling it to the porcelain gods.  In the morning I was able to eat without a single lean.    The sad thing is that I initially enjoyed my experience here.  I had excellent service which I tipped very well for and was ready to write a favorable review that was until the sheriff knocked and served notice on my meal.

Oh, so *this* is where the South Park folks go for Sunday brunch after church.  This was next on our Sunday Brunch series, and we will DEFINITELY be returning. Our server, Mattison (cool name, right?) was sweet and super helpful. The lady and I were persuaded to try out the doughnuts as an appetizer, which were AMAZING. Light, fresh-out-of-the-oven cinnamon sugar dusted mini doughnuts accompanied by chocolate, raspberry, and creme anglaise dipping sauces. Highly recommend to everybody.  I ordered the chicken and waffles, and the lady ordered the crab benedict, which Mattison kindly suggested adding avocado and tomato to.  I really don't want to type too much or else I might start drooling over my keyboard, but the chicken was moist and perfectly fried, the waffle was amazingly fluffy and flavorful by itself, and the lady's crab benedict had massive chunks of real crab with an amazing hollandai--- sorry, can't go on.  The service was awesome, the food was amazing, the portions were huge... after our brunch series is done, this will be somewhere we will be returning over and over again. After all, I've yet to try their deviled eggs... and all of the rest of the menu. Till next time, Bricktop's. You've served us well.

I really enjoy it here. The food no matter what time of the day has always great, it is nice to come to a place on a numerous occasions and know the food is going to be consistent. The millionaire bacon and deviled eggs are to die for. They have a wide variety of dinner options and a great drink menu, which have all been good that I have tried. The bistro chicken is my to go to, and the sides are all unique and delicious.

We had dinner reservations at another local eatery just around the corner, and since we had some time, we decided to stop in for a drink.  Bar is classy, drinks wonderful but pricey .  I had the Barrel Aged Manhattan, and my friend had a Raspberry Martini. Our drinks mixed well and a great pour, glasses were full to the brim--I will never complain about too much booze!!! Our server at first was great but then seemed to be bothered--we needed a couple extra napkins due to the pour, and she even joked we needed sippy straws--hard to get that first sip with the glass overflowing--oh well.  Again, the drink was made well, but service could use improving--maybe when too big a pour, give me a side car!

Had not eaten here in years, BF knows some servers there so we went... it was excellent. We were there on Sunday around 430ish so it was very quiet.. BF has sushi (I dont eat) he said it was amazing... we also did a 1/2 of the deviled eggs and 1/2 candied bacon... both were good, bacon was a little much but it was something different to try. We also split the pizza with the beef, cant remember since its been a bit if it was short rib pizza? It was good, felt like it could have used a little less cheese and some sort of sauce... maybe a drizzle of BBQ on the top and that would have really kicked it up. I would definately go back and bring friends who had never tired... was delish!
Best mac n cheese in Charlotte and best ahi tuna burger  ever.  The service was good and awesome bloody mary bar for Sunday brunch.

Lovely. Late dinner while in town for business.  We had dinner at the bar and the serving was attentive and helpful with beer and food suggestions.  Upscale dining. I enjoyed my salmon and cheesy cauliflower. Dan had the ribs and enjoyed. We heard, later, this eatery is known for their ribs. Great grapefruit cocktail with rosemary?  We'd be back if in town again.
Food is good and service is good. But nothing is great, except the millionaire bacon. And in my opinion the food is over priced. I have the 4 star ranking because the food is good.
Excellent brunch spot. I come here often and the food is always fantastic. Enjoying one of my favorite things here today....Prime rib!!

We randomly decided to check out Bricktop's last Sunday as a last minute plan since we had to hit up the mall for some Christmas shopping.  I have been meaning to try them out for awhile but just seem to forget about it!  Anyway, we were there during brunch hours and the menu was fabulous, not to mention the plates of fluffy french toast and waffles that we saw passing by our table...BUT, we didn't go with a typical brunch.  We both ordered burgers.  I don't feel like I have earned the right to review this restaurant since we ordered burgers only...no apps, no dessert, no drinks, nothing special.  BUT--I HAD to give a shout out to the burgers at this joint.  I had the veggie burger and it was a DELIGHT!  It was by far the BEST veggie burger I have ever had.....and I have had a TON of them.  The waitress told us they make everything fresh in house and it was so obvious.  The veggie burger had such flavor and it was so moist!  It was falling apart a little bit but I didn't really mind because it was so good!  It was served with their french fries which were thin cut and very good as well.    My husband ordered their cheeseburger and he put it on the list of his top 3 burgers ever!  He has several dives he goes to in NY for a good burger so the fact that this burger made his top 3 list is truly amazing and speaks volumes for this restaurant.   I CANNOT wait to go back and try more of their menu items because if they are getting the burgers right then I am hopeful that other things will be amazing!!!!
My food was great! Meatloaf with cream potatoes was delicious. The meat cooked perfectly. But, the server did not give us bread and butter until we asked. Rather disappointed with the services.

My daughter took me here last night for my birthday (she's 19) we had reservations which was good because they were busy for a Wednesday night.  We were seated and greeted in a timely manner, I had a glass of wine already from the bar and my daughter ordered a sprite. We had appetizers of their bang bang shrimp, spinach artichoke dip, Caesar salad and lobster bisque. All was tasty except the Lobster bisque which has brandy in it.  It was fine for the 1st couple of spoons but after that it gets to be too much. My daughter ordered the NY Strip, I ordered the Chilean Sea Bass.  Her steak was perfectly cooked medium and delicious, the sea bass had a sesame gravy like sauce that I did not care for.  The stir fry vegetables that came with it were great thought and very tasty.  I took only one bite of my sea bass.  I put my plate to the side. When the server asked us if everything was ok (at least 15 minutes after we had our food) my daughter mentioned I did not like my dinner. She asked if I would like something else like dessert (not another entry) I said sure because my daughter likes their key lime pie. The manager also came by to ask about getting me a dessert. The point is the sea bass was $38 yet you offered me a $7 dessert. The server was new and sweet but she didn't come back to refill my daughter's sprite till the end of the meal, didn't know what the Cobe steak was nor what was in the BG salad.  All in all, it was just ok

My update is LONG overdue.  I have been to Bricktop's so many times since 2012 and I hate that I have not updated my rating.  Needless to say every visit has been extroadinary last night's visit kicked this place to a five star rating in my book. I called ahead and put my name in, for two, and was told 45 to 50 minutes. Upon arrival we checked in and headed for the bar. The bartenders were SO attentive and delivered water while we previewed the drink menu.  Wanting to try something new the bartender gave me her take on a few drinks so I went with the French Martini, vodka, chamboard and pineapple juice...Loved it!  My guest enjoyed a Cabernet. We enjoyed our cocktails and after 35 minutes were seated at a booth table in the bar.  Our waiter arrived and brought water and bread, wish was so warm and fresh, it just started the meal off perfectly.  On this visit I decided to indulge with the Crab Cakes and Mashed Potatoes and was able to also taste the Trout with Lump Crab Meat and Deviled Eggs my date ordered. The deviled eggs, how have I not ordered these before??? The creamy yolk was to die for.  As for the entrees, the trout was cooked too perfection with a creamy butter sause and large lump crab scattered on top. As for the crab cakes, they were too die for. All crab meat with VERY little filler. From the cocktails, service and food Brickop's is not a place to not check out. I look forward to getting back there soon!

Ok so I first went here when a friend of mine started working here......would've never tried it otherwise. But wow I was surprised how good it was! American food....how boring! But everything I've ever had had been wonderful and my son who is very picky loves It too......and he orders the salmon ....not exactly kid fare and the only place he will eat it! Anyway....awesome martinis with house made infused vodkas. I've had the flat bread,all the salads, and brunch and it is excellent. Service is always spot on and that is hard to come by. A pleasant surprise!

This is one of the best restaurants in the area. It's definitely a little more expensive than surrounding places but it's worth every penny!   I have a lot of allergies (shellfish, peanuts, & nuts) and this is one of the few places I am able to eat the fries. They have their own frier and don't share oil with the shellfish. This alone is a huge plus to me. Plus the fries are amazing and perfectly crunchy.    All the food at this place is amazing. I came once when I met up with my old coworkers and another with friends who were visiting. All my friends Saint the place was "on point" and a "great decision". This will definitely be one of my go to places in the future.    The staff was also great and super attentive. I can always tell how good staff is when the manager comes and speaks to me personally about my allergies and to make sure I can eat what I want to order.   Highly recommend to everyone!

Fancy restaurant that fits right in to the very spendy Southpark neighborhood. Starting with two hostesses to greet, a large and well decorated dining area, white table linen and three staffers to take care of our table (one who did nothing but refill water glasses). If you're looking to impress, this will get 'er done.  We started with the goat cheese bruschetta which was more like a small goat cheese and veggie pizza as you'll see from the picture. Which isn't to say that it's not really really tasty and quite filling. You could easily have this as your main course.  But we didn't. Today was a "salad" day. I went with the Cobb, my wife had their "Florida". Both were good portions of protein and were very flavorful. Interesting plating for the two salads. They must put them into a cylinder of some sort where they build the layers and then "flip" it onto the plate. It looks pretty.  My only complaint is that while there was blue cheese in the salad, the dressing on the side was a balsamic and oil rather than a blue cheese dressing itself.  $14 for the pizza... I mean bruschetta and $18 or so for each of the two salads. A little expensive for a late lunch but it was quite good and I'd recommend it.

Stopped into Bricktop's for lunch one day so that I could use a gift card I had won.  Had never been, but a gift card is as good a reason as any.  We arrived at around 12:30pm on a weekday and here's your first pro-tip:  Dress smart.  We were all wearing jeans and we stuck out like a sore thumb.  Definitely more a business casual-type place.  We had to wait approx. ten minutes to be seated, but when we were, we were greeted warmly by our waitress.  She took our drink orders and gave us a run-down of the specials.  My co-worker and I decided on the fish tacos, while another co-worker went with the beef/mashed potato/carmelized onion flatbread.  It took about 15 minutes or so for our food to arrive, and while waiting, I checked out the jukebox.  It. Is. Awesome.  I queued up some MJ, Coldplay, Oasis, Verve, Bruce, Frank Sinatra, and Billy Joel.  Our food arrived and we dug in.  Two tacos came two to an order and the fish of the day (and everyday) was mahi-mahi.  The tacos were really tasty.  The spicy salsa was right on and there was some decent brown rice on the side.  My flatbread co-worker enjoyed her pizza, but found it to be a tad salty.  For dessert, we decided on the cookie.  Delicious.  And now I know why they keep it in the skillet (if they took it out, it would just ooze everywhere).  Bricktop's is a little outside of my normal price-range.  While the tacos were good, I don't know that they were $14.00 good.  On the other hand, I think that dessert is worth the $7.00.  I'll come back, but it will be a special occasion.  And rest assured, I will be kickin' out the jams on the jukebox!

I can honestly say this was the worst steak I've ever had. I ordered the American Kobe sirloin and fries. The meat, and I use that term lightly, was definitely not sirloin. It had that cheap mystery lunch meat flavor that you would find in a bad taco and was more fat that beef. Since there was only about six ounces, mostly fat, I only got about two bites and that was more than enough to feel sick. At $28 a plate that's $25 too much.  The service was excellent and the atmosphere was nice. It just isn't enough to make up for the bad food and outrageous prices!
Came for lunch and had a great experience. Service was friendly, and prompt without rushing us.  I had the grilled salmon salad - cooked perfectly, flavorful, nice portion.

The sushi was delicious but the service was why I wanted to write a review. I couldn't help but notice how nice the servers were to each other. I saw them helping each other like a team and it was very noticeable. Melissa was great at the bar! She was friendly & efficient and treated my son and I with great consideration. We were only in Charlotte one night for a soccer tournament and we wanted to go somewhere fun. It was a little pricey but I knew that before we went. Thanks Bricktop's for a great experience!

I still keep my rating at 3 stars after my last two visits. The food and service were very good. I had the Filet this week and it was excellent. They are getting a price premium because of the neighborhood the restaurant is located in. The price value is good, not great.
Go for the brunch. The sugar bacon and Chicken & waffles are unbelievable.

After all the great reviews I guess I expected a little more but it didn't happen. The atmosphere is nice, relaxing, very country club-ish and so were the people on the day we were there. Everyone else was over 50 and it seemed like that kind of crowd. There was no background music playing, which was very noticeable.   The wait staff were very good, friendly, cheerful and quick. The menu looked delicious but the prices really didn't. My wife had the ahi tuna burger which was just the, ground up ahi tuna with fillers for $16. I had the French Dip sandwich which was good (but also $16) and the au jus had the distinct taste of butter. So much so that I thought the pasted baguette was buttered but it wasn't.  I don't think we'll be back. But hopefully other people will enjoy it. It just wasn't for us.

I've been to Bricktops quite a few times mostly for lunch, but recently when I tried the restraurant for dinner, it gave me a whole new appreciation for their food. Service was amazingly attentive, but not overly so, as they sat my friend and I for dinner. I chose a sushi appetizer (which I never knew they offered) AND IT WAS AWESOME. Their sushi menu is limited, but very good. For my entrée I picked the Prime Rib with loaded potato and the Prime Rib was huge and a perfectly cooked medium rare (just the way I like it) and the potato was loaded to the sky and tasted amazing. A great meal and very affordable based on the portions provided.
Just outstanding. Great atmosphere. Like a real NY steakhouse with the circular red booths. Great drinks. Friendly staff. Love it. Plan to spend money.

I love the atmosphere here. The first time I went it was a cold, rainy afternoon so there weren't many patrons. This time the after work crowd was out in full force. There was no wait thankfully. The server was warm and attentive, she easily answered any questions about what was on the menu.  I had a sushi roll (I think it was Dynamite) which was very good. Topped it off with their delicious baked macaroni and cheese. I always enjoy Bricktops.
